The Other DNT


The advertising industry is devising its own Do Not Track alternative through the Digital Advertising Alliance, the same group responsible for the blue AdChoices icon. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) continues publishing its own methods for consumer opt-outs, but the DAA claims its solution better serves both advertisers and users, according to Adweek. "We'll have monitoring and compliance," said DAA executive director Lou Mastria. "We'll have the whole industry buying into it. The broad buy-in is what makes it a meaningful program. We won't face the challenge about implementation and enforcement." Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001gvFdtLUNLs5gk0X564VAfdlb3_7ALRBiLCg0Ylu_YtzoXHHKbNnY15Tt-Lf2W2xoQF3gyC8HyjRNyGlN-mdQxtPzJkJgov966lo8ntTO92p11NTiuDOf2EvA99gO9oYKH9vkaxLWSfFM7vVJ5vlqRNIU6-Y8mx6rVbl4DX6Ke9v1w8e8p6W_c0ZDtDJ2j6HeDGQzUAIoZnF4Il9ugeZNBEq8co4w7rAbMpQsA182uE6jY7jBjYbPY2dUvFCeLueMn1Mg2t2S3sVGQHMD-am2sww6oMNUgRQG&c=6Ksnl0Xsuv_eNUeMbcPY30AIAHpE-V7vrA_B8LkfHcI3AA9n9R18CQ==&ch=ybU931s0-8xOrAVkom2FwCd6oiP-Y6tJdbdM5WGJYJ_xU94nyShjsg==> . 


Automating TV Ads


Suddenlink and Visible World are taking a step in the programmatic TV direct via a partnership that allows for more targeted ad delivery. Visible World CEO Seth Haberman told Multichannel News that this new system will reach over 1 million households. "Getting the right spots in the right programs and dayparts was previously a very manual process. The new tool now makes that process much easier, more efficient and ultimately more effective," Jerry Dow, CMO of Suddenlink Communications, said in a statement. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001gvFdtLUNLs5gk0X564VAfdlb3_7ALRBiLCg0Ylu_YtzoXHHKbNnY15Tt-Lf2W2xoTqUHJsHQADo71gjZLbCYBc-I8k1ha5pOTFGLBLYDMI8t0jmEDuwVLNpilQ3WGfd8sL90jz3b2xY6nhvGL59lYjdl-3spSNrhTASvpNzXYSan4tS_6o3HWKuhPqxiW7sIJD0ulzvazwY0uMtBrTQoXH4PFaTFQv6cifxesKb6gVxvgRvRGX-AH8_61fuFiMEg2MIMcpOgGpE=&c=6Ksnl0Xsuv_eNUeMbcPY30AIAHpE-V7vrA_B8LkfHcI3AA9n9R18CQ==&ch=ybU931s0-8xOrAVkom2FwCd6oiP-Y6tJdbdM5WGJYJ_xU94nyShjsg==> . 


More Cookies


Criteo has added iOS support to its mobile Web tracking solution in addition to supporting Android browsers, the company said Tuesday. Mobile users who visit a client's website on the Safari browser will be asked if they want to receive personalized ads by allowing Criteo to drop a cookie on the site. "If you agree, you'll receive a second notice that the cookie has been placed and you can always click on the AdChoices icon to remove it," said Jonathan Wolf, CPO at Criteo. "The user has complete transparency and control." Read the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001gvFdtLUNLs5gk0X564VAfdlb3_7ALRBiLCg0Ylu_YtzoXHHKbNnY15Tt-Lf2W2xoWMZKCOfqYQ75Jg4q_R4a6k98XMFmXGc54ls2WANLQzjsl90JStZpIAvrNfeKD1E5HbidZIIHLPT_FmcRDJHJQv5BHGv-Wxifn266KON4EkZWXm9ylj9msC0A_2G2DMLmjnnUy6vgoegeY4N1obIhExVSNF-hLOBhGTHewfelpX-Gn-K_QKx4B7yHp1INs0TaUuO0U9xSHs0wF1FZ3zOFQw6odgiW3jPCIgv8xdcqPmZFZhqX1idmMflp_frDIFj5&c=6Ksnl0Xsuv_eNUeMbcPY30AIAHpE-V7vrA_B8LkfHcI3AA9n9R18CQ==&ch=ybU931s0-8xOrAVkom2FwCd6oiP-Y6tJdbdM5WGJYJ_xU94nyShjsg==> . 


Digital Budgets


As consumers flock to digital platforms, marketers will increase their digital budgets by 10%, according to new Gartner research. The 285-person study also revealed that 77% of organizations have a chief customer officer (CCO). "Customer experiences with a brand or organization span so many channels - both online and off - that customers have come to expect consistent experiences, no matter where an interaction initially takes place," said Laura McLellan, research vice president at Gartner. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001gvFdtLUNLs5gk0X564VAfdlb3_7ALRBiLCg0Ylu_YtzoXHHKbNnY15Tt-Lf2W2xo8Q0ylcll0r30mYeh-AUTZApsxhVoUrfcWPRw2aUj7UbBiaBedq1VaFx5Z6-MQDs3pkC3vx3Fyupn2u6KxGzl07InMMSwA2AKB3EO5mfDyavEI3uFbbxt05bYAeBwDR4LhlkrdlAjJos=&c=6Ksnl0Xsuv_eNUeMbcPY30AIAHpE-V7vrA_B8LkfHcI3AA9n9R18CQ==&ch=ybU931s0-8xOrAVkom2FwCd6oiP-Y6tJdbdM5WGJYJ_xU94nyShjsg==> . 


Cross-Platform DSP


Programmatic buying platform Simpli.fi is increasing its integration list to include inventory from MoPub, Millennial Media and LiveRail, expanding its cross-platform reach. In addition, the company has improved its optimization algorithm. Simpli.fi's existing partnerships include AppNexus, OpenX, sovrn and Casale Media. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001gvFdtLUNLs5gk0X564VAfdlb3_7ALRBiLCg0Ylu_YtzoXHHKbNnY15Tt-Lf2W2xoPCpKmUAF4C53XwXs2A3G1moT7TXoHrYwLhVTTmAV8c84qeQ7tz6cO12xdTra0mQWChD8T_6pfJJUefqpcjeTl3Zb-kjx5fqUEy7Wsg2f-5AFToq6Ml3MmvyiP2mJdogwkXiWsZ8FsyIWo30kF8_WyrYHbLG3OmlqCV1iGWacZAnWOTP3gfXSv1xhAUUsMv0bs2icNX-PyI8mG1hul67wNF_3CvXVWrfPugadS_By5opqBTflnnlXrvWEAhILzxQGJOt_5yIzW-zU_xxpouoWbQVMEUGbKfZA&c=6Ksnl0Xsuv_eNUeMbcPY30AIAHpE-V7vrA_B8LkfHcI3AA9n9R18CQ==&ch=ybU931s0-8xOrAVkom2FwCd6oiP-Y6tJdbdM5WGJYJ_xU94nyShjsg==> . 



Name Change


Publisher network Glam Media used its NewFront presentation to announce its name change to Mode Media to appeal to both men and women. The company showcased 18 episodic series that it plans to distribute across its network with a $2 million budget, Ad Age reported. In addition, Mode plans on adding more male-oriented verticals to its network. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001gvFdtLUNLs5gk0X564VAfdlb3_7ALRBiLCg0Ylu_YtzoXHHKbNnY15Tt-Lf2W2xoj_d64pErQmCP2CvAWROUYF8PShy-0HzQtVi3uVsi_O-rbKsLcgS4cpdGm3dohn69HeGrdQNDsVF64UpJq_JqgZ155UZCM8v_I2h8bPsjJYMXy-MefMrtqa-PPQd0hq2yGEDZNzdz43_h6e_z4IfI_9P7lI1mEvi0QHM6qvHh_wR8K9o8-S5qxWak2RBHWg1l&c=6Ksnl0Xsuv_eNUeMbcPY30AIAHpE-V7vrA_B8LkfHcI3AA9n9R18CQ==&ch=ybU931s0-8xOrAVkom2FwCd6oiP-Y6tJdbdM5WGJYJ_xU94nyShjsg==> . Paid Social Pays 

Two short months after social media software company Sprinklr acquired social analytics services firm Dachis Group (see AdExchangerstory <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001gvFdtLUNLs5gk0X564VAfdlb3_7ALRBiLCg0Ylu_YtzoXHHKbNnY15HtcEyNRkUlEpVfv5IaPRS0YwqhM4Kh9OghRAkvl9NuMSUCjSUymbr0lQjJE4a1PZMZJ1uV6jwBszgH9di7X_TfxZ0OOjxEqbqYlca70bpaVLVucAw2JnVZgQwFEdhdZYklff7shVJfn2_PnBDlXGZ-nUtj1NdaBktn2yNAcez0oXZygJ9g4OgYuHS3p80ls422d9Hv-ZL8zljfZo9TPImPMZ5rsbFZWg==&c=6Ksnl0Xsuv_eNUeMbcPY30AIAHpE-V7vrA_B8LkfHcI3AA9n9R18CQ==&ch=ybU931s0-8xOrAVkom2FwCd6oiP-Y6tJdbdM5WGJYJ_xU94nyShjsg==> ), the company has closed a $40 million round of financing from a handful of investors including Battery Ventures and Intel Capital. And after CEO Ragy Thomas first alluded to the fact in February, the firm has added paid media capabilities to its platform to help brands and agencies manage social ad spend. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001gvFdtLUNLs5gk0X564VAfdlb3_7ALRBiLCg0Ylu_YtzoXHHKbNnY15Tt-Lf2W2xo_zMYOIYctpkDazOG7iuiRFlMOItQD9uQvNHcXfYwmmv-lVeiGxhj3wOQ8mb4sEY4_Mk9eZBUPHxCaHGIO6Wo9JuPQ2ItTg7rO-672K8yC7TwGcLwHkpYalvtXJovL9u2eS9G3tBoYRBMCteETniiRVyjNlupDVtg7Byurldd7sQ4MdGAmPUiOgeHjPydkSBQlt4iLXLzgHeb8pR99BUiwrKPy88yfgEv-YQv_IQY45-m0V2bKOIVykvFGN2SRdZIBqivm4CdVm5ygc0f7AszMw==&c=6Ksnl0Xsuv_eNUeMbcPY30AIAHpE-V7vrA_B8LkfHcI3AA9n9R18CQ==&ch=ybU931s0-8xOrAVkom2FwCd6oiP-Y6tJdbdM5WGJYJ_xU94nyShjsg==> .

*	Data-Driven Thinking column...Localizing The Message Makes Brands Relevant by Eli Portnoy, Thinknear <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-7votWScmnfq1fyB-yavvzt_Y49_npU1oiSbg8yTSTsOPPAeDBiXGwHurDtnPqkmhG3i83jvlAmi6sV_OH3WxMhegSvnliSCV-t1g2DIm1uI7MR-ogqTcBNyWuhNhOH-DiacyT4zbHeNCQKOGUB5nnkt9rWHTWZmAbzgjdAIDmmICfTYe0GU6SPF5mZBZugvnsHnk5mrJ5tcA=&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==>  "Once a brand is certain that its location data is reliable, it's time to think about other data, too. This can be as simple as the time of day, or as complex as weather and environmental patterns..." (visit AdExchanger)
*	Are Programmatically Purchased Native Ads Native Enough? <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-7zNf0rkobHH21d7UGXoKJgyUz4PKVOM5CRmvBvuKPYlwb9x4vsCUxnzzwQlmFdWtYjR-76z8ZQ3vwnYFvVvacsnB_pYs4x_IltlvNal_ThspgLJiZzDr8GWtDmiC0-YZqcsDMBrGxocGqUz3rkuD6SvNFqbM3r2oe3YWNQID_8UuGSBiWUCn_Omf5NTHQJjAvR-sYR4nMx-o=&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==>  "To be truly native, an in-feed ad must match the site's layout as well as its content, said Sacha Xavier, media and innovation partner at Neo@Ogilvy. For example, placing an in-feed mobile gaming install ad on a news site would be just as disruptive as a banner ad, Xavier pointed out. 'Native ads should be curated the same way you would curate content on a page,' she said..." (visit AdExchanger)
*	Adara Links Up With Havas Media For First-Party Travel Targeting <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-7db9KlCuYCfdSvzPCIG7E1b_vHdwGAPxEe4RBA30hso2JVrnMv984aMVKiOBoFuh_mTvaevwr3vNGZjNrUwaTDLhU4XtQYjzqoljvoF0EwnNmYbgka_Zyv4Oi83REHa14UDGRpaMEWKMAs2t-egoBL5k_ocgVSz4p0_1CXHLuOUZmf3pqPjLnAKOVcC0k3QYOqVhVDXViOmxldwK2AFAQ8f6D__bmTElk&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==>  "Adam Kasper, Havas Media North America CMO, noted conversion rates of up to four times higher on Choice Hotels and Emirates campaigns using Adara over other endemic travel sites. Adara maintains first-party data relationships with 70-plus travel suppliers, which Kasper identified as providing greater 'reach' than some providers..." (visit AdExchanger)

Digital Is The NewFronts


A new study released Monday by the IAB predicts that original digital video programming will become as important as TV programming within the next three to five years, and increased Internet ad spend will mirror that shift. The IAB's SVP of research, Sherill Mane, commented, "The buy side is not only foreseeing strong spending at the 2014 NewFronts, but is also recognizing the significant effect it has on their perceptions and budget decisions long after the last presentation is over." Go here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-71PrrOBdI4OrbpDteB6WMjWDRsTvg0EKMvQIqck5p7zp4U-9C0iO4_-qEyKpAg9h0n8bXwW9htGBlopz8CVtvlMx1G3H3xYQuV9upWSwAKlGDi_HUb1yg5w==&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==>  for the study. Read the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-7xcmzYr3a1XwoWO5-xarWMgFffXjYppccjJ9rKSUqhWIT7Kkdj-vff_iriAx4-h6hQXrqsw1vz2w7w9GRPEC8DagEovZpP14AzBO2B-nnsbReTtkH5O6Tgctq8GOg-LvXbFGYhkGDjdLjZsQNsdxhnFM9ehkhTDRDbNfxNEztmhBm9LsJXocZcX950de4e0ZWQ0a2z0bXCfxgWcox2TvLd3W4KOvmZuTVc5MDHuybaA0rueZM_Zzu7A==&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==> .

Managing The Spend


Facebook is appealing directly to the marketer with its ad campaign-management tools known as Business Manager. From a "Facebook for Business" post: "If you're advertising for yourself - say, you're on the in-house marketing team for a national brand - Business Manager shows you: 1. The Pages, ad accounts and apps linked to your brand..." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-7R0PXJNsDnQiUI8CWUyDw0n-9wOBZqPWuLkuPpYTzU5UaucOxWshEB_HheNIQ9KEmg1FWfga3DdzK3Q8NXGXNasZcuBTRg1g1I2WnW-HYhukye-yniVDmIABS-n_d-B6-eieA4iXKlSEOH_7hF2XNATakkteOza00&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==> . Available to a few US advertisers today, a full, international roll-out of Business Manager <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-7PuZVLSGPJ8ZiP1dGqYFoDggMwkF5d7n8n1OcUB13cSPxeRNJv0gEBaXCFlYu2Qv9dgcHfRvp2qN3SUB32btOrAQfwoZ4TbmB3qz2_6xP7faA9I2J6B3CmQ==&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==>  is planned in a few weeks, says Facebook. Considering the ill will over a loss of organic reach with their Facebook pages, layering on some cool tools in order to try to make nice with marketers isn't a bad idea for Facebook.

Saradakis Charged


Late last week, former eBay Enterprise and GSI Commerce (and PointRoll) exec Chris Saradakis as well as several others - including two of his family members - were charged with insider trading by the US Securities Exchange Commission (SEC). Read the release and view an SEC infographic <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-7edS_XXLcx6nY9Kq8mzKsZVfoyVJ9k_6kEP4r5f0MimJL9NxAG50VY3Tz5bWEXEQvEOFS5GSZ-a_zlivv00R-w8PjsxAVnyGlTPfevlrjwXgqxq69rZejrFrQZzw35dRxxUMAIXXndTxaYitXj37bbTWJTYClt4pw2QEqxFLas_wtEnzb0hnGzg==&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==> . Saradakis has agreed on a settlement. SEC associate director Scott Friestad said in a release, "Saridakis chose to dole out confidential, market-moving information to enrich relatives and friends, and the nonpublic details then spread further through multiple levels of tippers and tippees." Saradakis quietly left eBay in January <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNX1WnOMlz1yHmHVbozskHpHBarMUZpmiLsJQtcCpRcNhAfGn9AOp4g_jMXipxxkzVVKKL_kZcKiKN-QJiJk6C2D6yqv4gnecuOSXcscWjqyvfkZt6HTt_18KcFrQ9QSa913I-RMSmqJIf29ehCkKUOufLp70IzE522VU6raBGOpQCvb1iXzF5pA=&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==> . Read an AdExchanger interview <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNb1y-nhvCdnXuRw2tdHksv7zHhhOKXPizDM948TYvlEH49JHgcRWncPmIVomzOgVAFMc2tc_FV8x9PZiJYwTWatw0j1u_97Ymp9B6pcSeYfQgqfrxipgnWYH0KO3Jz7BRmJv33eak5C6wGKCEwen4maU66vEZEUovVSsr7le05YgyKpzcbveceY=&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==>  from 2011 with Saradakis when GSI bought Clearsaleing - two months before GSI was acquired by eBay <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNVhOjfuYB1sEGxGtQt_ZQTD9fo6WiHtS549TZMzFi2wrhNh2yLhU8WALVQyRbAaUQrLL6a2ixaBd3HRjCjAcZGZQmpnzXAQHtfG9rY3vUL849Jxnjxc1LkdEVDP9pn7VfMuuFXgpydbqqk3QooIMgqVhA7V_NB5Ohs4ltpIc7XavYy6V9l9akU0=&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==> . His LinkedIn profile <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-75YlSpFhFNOMzxKAsuQtke0SQU-tNveuwt_pkp3mENCz7r4i4SeY22lZGK8P4FFbOeEMz7CYCCbi9Hz9idxUEloMDe063zoMKqcQyjUbivojJ1FhGWW5Tutub94nCTTACIjhcCTd7pZobNP2LYll6oQ==&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==>  indicates he used to work at investment bank Lehman Bros. back in the day.

The NewFront Times


The New York Times showcased its video hub redesign on Monday morning. The NYT highlighted its latest digital video programming, including a new series called "Verbatim," which hosts actors from Upright Citizens Brigade re-enacting legal proceedings. Ad marketing will include pre-roll and sponsored videos, which will be clearly marked as advertisements, according to executive VP of Advertising Meredith Kopit Levien. AdAge has the story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-7Dg4izG-hMNK27Z3D2QOuVYnt_NleoOjL4sk-4QzS7aqUeaA5y4H69OU-8xKvxdeuh1uDIyHhrd6d8Z3ZPIwR5fnc_b-fV_BN82QsFN31_2HfY44TiGB0G5Po0acVhvCectAGmps61Pn2a5u7XGIOelJ8D3ot2lk0iGLFs4SexPxTWtfeKqzBOyDfJH9awFWtpvjr4zsxakbW4GTh1N-uN-4CpM7ctp0p&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==> . Digiday <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-75-dSJHPAzMCuiJ6EUWsLnbNo9z5psr2Uiopveotzvajb1BcIfsC-YNevhxWfhSmdr_8OZVcQuKN3mMIgOpxX0erKllMB6rP7_4znYkBD5HH4en_kS1c6IxL52HwJ5aIaNvfI-yIuxL5pXZLTeHFSnjtN88IXFfPYuSaQ5_u-b50pLVOgfrHHFuLCueDpptxt&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==> , too. Separately, Yahoo announced <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-72NfMgs1QsfSoF3VCrptLz8NQSzJzp6IJiq-sF7BBvZUYvKXxqQ07dXmCFqxwPx0UCTmXBznWJSex_yMzvqCOdqiSs_Zx1tOTwAogkyr9pO-5fYovpzcLLfZFe_XjurCNHnzsUUoVFGJSGnXXRJsUc8p9HpOwybYWyrt9R9p59PFkW15XSnJrndMeNRSjC0MbMJUd8SS8wbf6zr-RDkSTMA==&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==>  new ad formats and a Comscore partnership at its NewFront.

Rocky Merger


During Omnicom's earnings call last week, the company remained hopeful about its future merger with Publicis Groupe, despite tax hurdles that have slowed the process. An article Monday via Adweek suggests the merger may not be as evident as both companies claim. According to sources, the CEOs have been butting heads over merger decisions. Brian Wieser, a senior analyst at Pivotal Research Group commented, "Omnicom looks like it is trying to create a condition to get out of the merger. It's almost like they're looking for ideas to create plausible doubt." Read the story in full <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-7TI51pxUa_-5LTwykicwxmcOHsfPripLuaPB9n-BXyYIyVN668AjRbuffgwsLYoMFZ0EUqEi3KxJ1ywl_4wXIeb5O5BokuVf0mHaLRTL1kYZzJbBgopiSAw-2qMPoLOrDHGqewdokAlpYk9bqSzeQXAU-DYYelQ3IvchWk3xv5mQuWgh6wEeMr52-bn3Un_msK2jVufSlyEn1JJk_MgrW_oO2ggr-5Fks&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==> .

Going Private


On MediaPost, former NY Times programmatic media exec Matt Prohaska reviews what he sees as the current tilt by big publishers to open ad exchanges. He writes, "I believe this will change over the next 12 months as more publishers get their integrated programmatic sales efforts going and place more inventory in the private exchanges labeled appropriately and proudly." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-7kSjZgzGL1uT4Q1k8JT2GR9un90riMy2BSAvxuLdK18-YwSr0nDxpHPWlVUmr6s5u2G-VeRb_y6H5OIo2bsKsyzYi5UoSYRmFvpcvU24HPnzizZ_Baf0gHJ5KjD15YoKmKhUnbI5FZg65RLy_zpIEXa30OYUywJBWPEQjKKBHuUVnUY8pQUyDjj0cg_u0AxDouzO71nA2vXA949aV3UaLi_7TIKMTNlDd&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==> . 


Mixed Responses


SeekingAlpha reports on the Rubicon Project, with mixed coverage from IPO underwriters. Goldman Sachs, RBX and Oppenheimer remain neutral, whereas Morgan Stanley and Needham assigned Rubicon bullish ratings. Needham's Kerry Rice say's Rubicon's cloud architecture "automates the complexities plaguing the digital advertising ecosystem, and in doing so creates a defensible position."Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001iS8yUX0aBwm-UK58fPCMiqAQ3cI8PSRXgBGlokI9sdJHxHTWNotgNT1R-cOGL4-7JgYm1B4wyWTF00VksVU-I37NNOyJTjhujQ7eAzIHP3ICQUla7TeyKHY92EhjeRziOym4HSvwuicBPnt2uCMhUpkL953ek0qTpPPkbHjB-F43XyKdQCO8Z4Kr4MCX1W6Vcf0J4euNfW1NPhY_LYNu3nuzgZMJbW5FRo8928TZXKzYs6QYyzN9yuiCgW8VS_TbGjVfJwZqW9iyer-3Oh_L44zxzk-H4dy_IT_CCu8OLUc=&c=No0UydhwOfLnX4B33f6r3GIOjnqUfAWCchf1jFens806ET2Mm0URkA==&ch=BLQDO-Hek5TapSZKDKxv3mzMoeVaNGbZ9TMp8SLix1m264WvIdLEgQ==> .

Chahal Out As RadiumOne CEO

 

Re/code's Kara Swisher broke the news Sunday that the board of ad tech platform company RadiumOne decided to remove CEO Gurbaksh Chahal after he pleaded guilty to two misdemeanors for battery and domestic violence related to an incident with his girlfriend. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQIInTrsSw7rQOPky0flfWYEF0232XRjcosyezkBKjHm62QGaKj3QnPV5ycvSlZIOiew3sTmbhqcsSEjtRu5ARMK8HWnyE3XL3Qjoboo0cLLTGM0O1N6qrmVZ13b50UHHn_1dK0Re5rjOa2S65bTrBESOuxS8b3DRKO2TMrvoDRPFHwB3uYJoTebUKtjrDOiyRuWwaMo-3m8EY=&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> . It was later confirmed by the company that COO Bill Lonergan (LinkedIn <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQIDYWE-yC8sYK0vwHu_50j_KlNf5GiJx4xksB6UL1vwuHAPqEVkYgSfuHi-f7kAGmllq4-kORmsY3oomIal7yPDzMwUFirqi7hPJBMQHuTcdcqwRKeI_JSnscVqBTCw4FLZgAZbloV2e_szzAG8YvGDg==&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> ), formerly of OfferPal and Chahal's BlueLithium ad network, is the new CEO, according to the RadiumOne's "Leadership <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQIS7-xUP5JNZaHId-y2JyY-GlKwaaDnZ_iBGGgbqYz-5LHB6hfp0E8svKDI-LXJYVMhis0azH_NTWanJM8KXWnwyLRepUmwhxxz4qrupkBpHvRSPsgR88aMDY5rFR4PpKWbJqBepg2lEs=&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> " page and a press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQIN9DrjfFkLSSEnuqDBigKEp2cbQtXuXMSofvUPT7wf-e0n5TtHfh0NEYWMncWfvU4JclB2d5IAdDjlLme3n1x_9IJv3xp6-1jftjAEFeo9Nv75bFqgPwFpOvhVgig7vTsrVL-zIvAVq50EpdMJm_wIqOL764iYh6OmWpHsnR1mphU2x4RqmdgMBOAM5GXheJIK_Ffu7FNTYwr-Int2VTXAvZuzJChTdSf&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> . The firing followed a lengthy explanation from Chahal on his personal blog on Saturday explaining his POV on what happened. Read that one <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQInsSI9Ao_eATpJT7Q9ctAyZoirWC2mqi1S8O84N1ezlBix9MfNjtxar6LjBP4DnWObeuN8HD8Y6_772JaolOeWSC-8FjWYVS9J-0IL8Yuli07-Hk5BT2KpQvLOQ-WZc9NKyV1NbIcbQg=&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> .

 

Making Video Inventory

 

On Friday AOL and Microsoft announced a video distribution deal scheduled to begin this summer. The agreement will extend content from AOL brands such as HuffPo and TechCrunch, as well as partner site like ESPN and TMZ, to MSN and Bing Apps for Windows. AOL video President Ran Harnevo commented, "AOL has seen tremendous audience growth over the last few years -- views for our content are up nearly 75% in the last year alone -- and the sheer scale of Microsoft's network will help us reach a massive new audience and continue our climb." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQIxHdqPoMNChsOoySEidzKGWIz9dyMCEQFcgkKgAAwg_q2q-Lxqsw2rVKSeWsqx9AemEZR6X-qOx5VEuTrZv7ttCKWpLE6J-y3ehnl-TF6yUjUJ75XhWuBTh8XWg_vU-KimjK5GZYSnlQugaU1sw7XZcdOAsMl74Emz8V5tcRLtayz_Rxs66CG62hXACrCQsZYHaWXVk0KwzgXsQNMzQMStVHF8FbTzcoKMrrZVkfdUZfzOJ8IsYO8xg==&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> . 



VOD Advertising Ticks

 

After watching ads problematically replay on video on demand, AdWeek's Mike Shields singles out the ticks of programmatic and blames the consortium of cable operators for the ad mishap. Despite Comcast's purchase of ad tech company FreeWheel, ad frequency remains an issue. "It's hard not to draw the conclusion that they don't care much about VOD," writes Shields, "Because either the money or audience isn't that big. Let's hope that FreeWheel, assuming that Comcast implements its technology for all of NBCU's networks, can make VOD a more viable, dynamic ad market." Read more via WSJ <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQIX5v234LZDEZEL9E7DAHlGjNucfXaEtWTUT2VniJLQEuXnTLpS0s86pHeteLj80d22PVGNpc626NWxWWKCszyVNrZm_PsTi1ql5oEV53z7QAN58Il6wVOp1wXm5R18vNt2wX0MqKHdePk7LX-tfDu314Fyrz90FF1JYHuvc8wpCdcbqTjNFS62YtWQjA3pIlj&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> .

 

Ad Network Update

 

TechCrunch's Josh Constine gets wind of the name for the mobile ad network that Facebook is expected to launch on Wednesday at the F8 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQInOauWKS22q6J-A1P0Y0IX-yWeHtUh1Rr5qDbBs-Dh5JWvCyUvxywTTYO8ek2Km_aaI6jdJjvutRPdcc_YN-TFQNH7xiIoBjSyJgSFNmyJ4astrVEW0Glmg==&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==>  developer conference. FAN (no, not Fox Audience Network <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRl53Mhrtqh7XVPg_TFf6VgUZ67Ky2PXrc6XrKuWMQaN9rjuZgS68-bYpb52SytMmMRrpEHcRIJW1kT5jFsb1smhyqQa2vJh8ZiTo8vNMOWV3UJIVtaprAGV9W5S0Hl17e1eTrU2z20YeLGfELZmcp9jsB0GSKZA5m5kPLaGcgtXm2XoIkQjSN_R10H8Cj6NU8cjMmwtIxhsZyIGMmFiKox0=&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> ) is Facebook Audience Network and Constine says standard mobile ad units and custom units will be part of the mix. About one "Custom" use case: "A lockscreen or homescreen replacement for Android could show 'suggested apps' that are essentially app install ads." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQI1FT3x3ATBlmuYY4L3fc1zzpHckD-veMvjNDnbir1MQgx1T-iICh5DrS8d2OlaGywn3_OgnolxPNCisnp1C6dTshh2kZfGuXx4ZPyg0JdtkoGmppUmwFdhA3zWexbExYglqlibjjJyOszCiQKNOQ8kqg0Q-UAe8dVLlDwzFEx0o8=&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> . Couldn't this network still be used for PC-based display, too? Is FB really going to be sniffing for a smartphone? More details may come Wednesday. AdWords vs. FAN. Get ready.

 

Turner Seeking Agency

 

TV marketers are starting to show an interest in real-time advertising in social media. AdAge reports that Turner Broadcasting will use its upfront talks to scout out an agency or major marketer for "Real Time Now," part of Turner's "Now Media" pitch to advertisers. Designed to plug marketers with spots on TBS and TNT, messages from brands will also appear on Turner's social media channels such as Funny or Die. Affording marketers access to the social conversation on TV could prove to be an untapped opportunity for networks. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQIdX0Im62aMO8nNi6xnH8FWlHwPFuEL1TlhZzH_Sgj_H3L_bSiRQuday1Z5RZ05_vbych37sZqgT_hgzG3aquO2wTtYTmb80tCPtVPGg1Ff3JsNZF3QGvNAXP3SQMCVY93L_OG3Ne_eXbMwWRul_5_gdayrmJzKhz94ZLPgbmRhCyCs97H1ms0xwa5hPeSSdQ1&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> . 



Native Might Shape Digital Marketing

 

A recent report conducted by BI Intelligence suggests that social media ad budgets are shifting to native, in-stream advertising. For the report, BI Intelligence spoke with major ad buyers within social media networks such as Pinterest to determine how native-social advertising might transform digital marketing. The study image and video centric networks like Vine and Snapchat might offer the most effective native ads in the near future, as photos remain the most shared type of content on the Web. Go here for the report in full. Business Insider has the story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQIFoAaDd001u6FKDic6k2Iu8Ht_rekVsMbyLg6Wq8APlV9PBlurvI37Qaa4J8IQE1N8N7gDrGhuzW1wVJHAKY7zReAj1LyeFUqmgHKC3eGNCt5qN_K9lvBhi13aRGkfCFtsyMbypVNvp4r-HgK3N7SoDnUk-a9VPD83gRLA43wZraaHYQ5vNUeHXqkDPgxPh_8f2lvpgxvNiXst7mrz7qV2Q==&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> .

 

Website Card Ad

 

On Friday, Twitter revealed a new ad unit designed to let advertisers surface website content within a tweet and consequently redirect relevant traffic to their Web pages. Twitter has tested their new "Website Card" with brands such as Citrix and Betabrand with positive results, and the social media platform is now offering the creative unit to all marketers for both mobile and desktop. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001w36F4Yl6h791cb01GgGyfZMqcb1BwQF5_BlOzjJcnb7oKNwMX42RRi6LEqRiHxQI5z6GoOWAZRCqvK51Z6OkMvFAJwuT9WT7umnwbY8VBSOpIq_s1oUc-XYO3BPqYqGcAIOzpMIhUIKiKwSj-BO9bG3v7E29Pe9SnaUM3L1QTSLOfrhgW9UgiQXa5jNWrXIqYVQ-pPnYPqSrhYz9DG4ZTCeClac2ukf-0BcyO-5XvEyTcysOVlcCjheHR76C1M9jYZa7th6uSa8=&c=tpFs2QUAIzmhEd1WVg_PZ2e9wMMjMyzq77W53BiewkaHX7n4JQ7rCw==&ch=uNREC1x2zNwGm6oZxxfpWaT7yKzz0t3tciOxm_bQmbKmbLsDQZiXEA==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001x9GqTUdsr8u6vkAwKFAv27efr4TfekAJ3RO98YQ-YykL2FOBrCsbbWN5PgF3KoDrQzYHhuBkEJg5Esp64NcUVDS7GnGHztwCJJzvRRLFwA2IfmtlAsEBE32ZFpyvScS0jViiLgka3ZVBchcrsnxlF3MDCNIIJ9NBJ5tVy4Abt5ECM4lMRJTNFmm1cPJgWARn&c=kesCIIWQTYS-kQYmqEQhN-6uymK9fTpTGuvAhH8PvFa05db_qZsvqw==&ch=ShYUtX6GLlOuJM3VLIB6BsTZFjROK3UMh8hFaVgsmO1qEn1nRJlKzQ==> .

 

Native: Mobile Gateway Drug

 

Ad companies are increasingly focusing their efforts on native advertising for mobile, as users spend more time on tablets and smartphones and less on desktops. The WSJ reports that overreliance on banner ads have hindered marketers from mobile ads in the past, but native breaks the road block. Said Jim Payne, VP of Twitter's ad exchange, "We've learned that not only are native ads a significant improvement for publisher monetization in general, but that users engage with these ad formats at a higher rate than the desktop-era banners and interstitials that are so prevalent today in mobile." Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001x9GqTUdsr8u6vkAwKFAv27efr4TfekAJ3RO98YQ-YykL2FOBrCsbbbaLdwSVuCWXH15M2HC9crTSKjUf51GGo7DuTwwG2J8I29ucOq9bSW7WsH0XKjXZmuHMV218DAZ0-U0R8hfeTDT-fQtbkdH3wzLlWU-tVvZmlk61jjb4XOMNfBvh91lG19eh6aUkqCxZDaoBtOpFxe3-sohkNWMg837CzE5BaX7fKCmZJA3gaHmvrVP_JTBUG1S91-jvWXcE&c=kesCIIWQTYS-kQYmqEQhN-6uymK9fTpTGuvAhH8PvFa05db_qZsvqw==&ch=ShYUtX6GLlOuJM3VLIB6BsTZFjROK3UMh8hFaVgsmO1qEn1nRJlKzQ==> .

 

Humanizing Programmatic

 

Writing for AdAge, CEO of Qvidian Lewis Miller says the human element of marketing automation is what allows organizations to be contextual and adaptable in order to execute sales. "If marketing automation is the first step, technology should also equip sales representatives with the insight and logic. ... B-to-b buyers are buying from people, not processes or technology. It takes a human element to interpret the data to optimize the process and experience for the specific buyer - otherwise you're just automating bad practices." More <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001x9GqTUdsr8u6vkAwKFAv27efr4TfekAJ3RO98YQ-YykL2FOBrCsbbbaLdwSVuCWXZbLWUWv-5N5-Nx1xaJtsIQ8h9AvilGTAyD9kka7aWzV5cBDqhJS53iR3RkNRVajbomUrK-YiRGF0N58hB00xkrrmBik9kt7SXawzz6Tis8_gg3_iX5f8b6E_pQ7CKawS0g7428jSSkIiEe8pjvaUc0paq_nWsje2AtbTA0xM83f_jsbO32ohEIGFe3KGkNq0DyycOqoYj-q3ZSB1LicQOZznycdJsQlo&c=kesCIIWQTYS-kQYmqEQhN-6uymK9fTpTGuvAhH8PvFa05db_qZsvqw==&ch=ShYUtX6GLlOuJM3VLIB6BsTZFjROK3UMh8hFaVgsmO1qEn1nRJlKzQ==> .

 

Atlas Makeover

 

In the year since Atlas joined Facebook, the company has partnered with Innovid, Flite and Microsoft Advertising, and has ramped up product development. Now it has a new look, including a website refresh and new logo. A blog post alludes to bigger plans. See it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001x9GqTUdsr8u6vkAwKFAv27efr4TfekAJ3RO98YQ-YykL2FOBrCsbbbaLdwSVuCWXa2-YOFgBQk2ycqueSp5dT_crsjvzd-FynW1J3nv9UMNVyxYfPpn0iwTnkZtW1gLDjtME2JdoCoF_VEzKxbZiz2IBVSxsmKS6zME0ZHP9px4Zi_6fowmtVW2udQL-ClBCRyM66wyqblhwVXeXtDhwSxgXznI-r3YImphnl0jipqU=&c=kesCIIWQTYS-kQYmqEQhN-6uymK9fTpTGuvAhH8PvFa05db_qZsvqw==&ch=ShYUtX6GLlOuJM3VLIB6BsTZFjROK3UMh8hFaVgsmO1qEn1nRJlKzQ==> .

 

Wearable Marketing

 

Wearable tech will change marketing, first through the data and then through the formats. "The big opportunity for marketers really lies in the data area," IAB Australia's Alice Manners says in a CMO story. "What wearables provide us is a much more granular understanding of user behaviour, and that is going to change the way in which mobile marketing happens." While visual ads may need to take a simpler format, audio opportunities could expand marketer reach. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001x9GqTUdsr8u6vkAwKFAv27efr4TfekAJ3RO98YQ-YykL2FOBrCsbbbaLdwSVuCWXrtnWMJM7gjNyKcPAZkbdF16Gx7_lTa6egriWM9Y1AOQx0U3CoAUTFnLNGUYi_r9WPQLWDamzOGTCK7s0R8-kL8unzfCo-bGucKs1OzZw6H60zSDLw9XlVkwExfjFB_JxuQgoJe-eD792iZSFdV64CQGcz1A0SBHmscqocRKsqIorz-Zt6pFmItMz_MG6khiT&c=kesCIIWQTYS-kQYmqEQhN-6uymK9fTpTGuvAhH8PvFa05db_qZsvqw==&ch=ShYUtX6GLlOuJM3VLIB6BsTZFjROK3UMh8hFaVgsmO1qEn1nRJlKzQ==> .

 

Global Mobile RTB Report

 

Real-time buying (RTB) in mobile is growing on a global scale. New data from Smaato suggests entertainment and tech verticals will grab the majority of ad spend. Read the report <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001x9GqTUdsr8u6vkAwKFAv27efr4TfekAJ3RO98YQ-YykL2FOBrCsbbbaLdwSVuCWXegE-KiO-33Px9TOIIUgYgVuLuU5bc_Ldw6v4tZJ4hxIS45qvTaBqP69X8UWTJmJqHSl2cWxrNedVz_HByX3CPQio1Xg95Naya5wYQhdYHK5TZQGmRPI-og==&c=kesCIIWQTYS-kQYmqEQhN-6uymK9fTpTGuvAhH8PvFa05db_qZsvqw==&ch=ShYUtX6GLlOuJM3VLIB6BsTZFjROK3UMh8hFaVgsmO1qEn1nRJlKzQ==> . Or the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001x9GqTUdsr8u6vkAwKFAv27efr4TfekAJ3RO98YQ-YykL2FOBrCsbbbaLdwSVuCWXzYO1eUHaAjhq6h1jk1qdzaxxRwGRR6OS0NQaq8K_b_3VNbYMJMeL_SfUBA4KxhMKyrXMIOWYuUNZcm_Ubj97KHTiEmue6vgMCCzyqVeHlpOqGxoZ7Nj-vulwO1uzKxJQxoMWSPhpirkc4EjPb-5DVQi87CqsTFLNPtXZe-E3TGNFqnshDpRLRfQirkhG-cyYTgudhvrtLD5_qwevwEWp2OBl_c2zF8U83XdX40JrgzsX-VZn1ylZJ3yP4qeBUgrw&c=kesCIIWQTYS-kQYmqEQhN-6uymK9fTpTGuvAhH8PvFa05db_qZsvqw==&ch=ShYUtX6GLlOuJM3VLIB6BsTZFjROK3UMh8hFaVgsmO1qEn1nRJlKzQ==> .

 

Data At MDC Partners

 

MDC Partners' launch of creative agency Assembly in March (AdExchanger story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001x9GqTUdsr8u6vkAwKFAv27efr4TfekAJ3RO98YQ-YykL2FOBrCsbbaoruoL5F3oYE-beb-KUHaHF0WKmWlVdesZPxEs5KEhwmMkQYqVGyhGmq33chBpuMfWlCroNpRYlyfURrwpJ6iKlkdT02qF8IbEbt_SoMeBYOfwNi1eUyRrTZR1e7w_mdxps4xtbGsOau4GDal99FmM-vCOtt5AK-h7NKwd1fXMqPx3DcAIWF7TJvsS8RS4LN17xKcYKTippMHCnSJ_8QSw=&c=kesCIIWQTYS-kQYmqEQhN-6uymK9fTpTGuvAhH8PvFa05db_qZsvqw==&ch=ShYUtX6GLlOuJM3VLIB6BsTZFjROK3UMh8hFaVgsmO1qEn1nRJlKzQ==> ) was part of the holding company's push to leverage technology and data to drive better performance for clients' media. "This is further illustrated in our programmatic capability at Varick Media Management and our emerging local search platform LBN," the company said. Earnings release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001x9GqTUdsr8u6vkAwKFAv27efr4TfekAJ3RO98YQ-YykL2FOBrCsbbbaLdwSVuCWXXwkU9j0wul-osmPW5CM2_szx6BEeAqo3kDP6l2IYgIY1gTD33ipusN-6SIdf1yNmHNPxAIh0wgWaDwOW9rijISKeOA0KmaZJqW6TWvZc8KGxpRVJk3Pu03Zp-Ql1pn-gTYU1uxrh9bezaRXNvjOH5IcXsp3o_XOFWM3X0FfIi1M9Ii9vo2TG6_7vx4P55WnM4JkhY_UgzkrDkn96oZr2S8AtkgBJIyKWpF8yMLXeJt0Wez9V99wLm_CHScJ0MpD4xtL1U-sWwc8viYUkML5LlQ==&c=kesCIIWQTYS-kQYmqEQhN-6uymK9fTpTGuvAhH8PvFa05db_qZsvqw==&ch=ShYUtX6GLlOuJM3VLIB6BsTZFjROK3UMh8hFaVgsmO1qEn1nRJlKzQ==> .

 

Piqora's Long Game

 

Piqora raised $7.7 million, bringing its total funding to $11 million. The analytics company's "Instagram Conversation Manager" lets brands engage Instagram users outside of the mobile app. It will use the funds to add more image recognition specialists to its team, build deeper visual analytics and expand its content-management and CRM capabilities to other networks. Read the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001x9GqTUdsr8u6vkAwKFAv27efr4TfekAJ3RO98YQ-YykL2FOBrCsbbbaLdwSVuCWXc-Jnd8E7hIq3pdS4-0oIuTN-EifONjFdpi8YexMeiodaTpmEHNgfYpLCRYgCzwdWsvYno-GYY4WReFxTvYpP2osJS9G7nFkLHETxm7LWR86YMwKZOTogs2uLuzWSq_y1hBLPu1hWhN4Vue0UBk8yxcA0K5eaI7de&c=kesCIIWQTYS-kQYmqEQhN-6uymK9fTpTGuvAhH8PvFa05db_qZsvqw==&ch=ShYUtX6GLlOuJM3VLIB6BsTZFjROK3UMh8hFaVgsmO1qEn1nRJlKzQ==> .

The number of users who access Facebook and its apps daily via a mobile device jumped 43% to 609 million globally, and monthly active mobile users surpassed 1 billion. Mobile now contributes 59% of the company's total ad revenues, up dramatically from 30% in Q1 2013..." (visit AdExchanger)

New (DMP) Challenger

 

Add another data-management platform (DMP) to the market. This one is from Norway-based Cxense (pronounced see-sense), a company that offers cloud-based digital analytics and audience data for publishers. Cxense is positioning the platform as the foundation for its application stack. The company's customers are mostly European and Japanese, and include Schibsted, Rakuten and The Economist. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001aCA1GqUvbfGh3XNhvntoZ658oDAU039pb09MHwseN3Yfc4jiSmsUXOkv-jGyWgVFHfdwBO2gABQuWFGG_4fa6iDjqgrAI7O0lQzoPtTNpJXAETWy-ZKQO4kQ3OCz1LHTnmdrQ1XbFwMHyISsEq858aCPnTSUMRXFZa-3GpAYNoTq2SRmxwFcFfz8yMLV4MV1KK7W_vVxYP87Mo9w9PktFg==&c=97aWwrYaowhsMZFxpBlVb4Z58u_IbvSZ5u4n-MxFq2449ZsT4-IKAA==&ch=5mKlf1ttnZkfHZSIZvPQcj3UYEr755IoXyxKncaMI0zNZ7XbE6aaEw==> .

 

Tracking TV Audiences

 

TV advertising and data provider BlackArrow launched Audience 2.0 on Wednesday, a data-management platform designed for pay-TV providers. Upgrades include a Web-based tool called Profile Manager, which allows providers to pool and manage first- and third-party subscriber data in one location. The tools let providers built custom audience segments and view the number of devices and households in audience groups. "The future of TV and where it's going is addressable advertising, robust measurement and personalized content," Chris Hock, an SVP at BlackArrow, told AdExchanger. The company is working with clients such as Comcast and Time Warner Cable. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001aCA1GqUvbfGh3XNhvntoZ658oDAU039pb09MHwseN3Yfc4jiSmsUXOkv-jGyWgVF7Q7g-gDFChTixOMMXlF2pupndt9hkEDEgsJJY-nl4LAMl4UvUTQeqhETzV9Il1z-50Tk-HYCSOSogXe1DdV8ok9BmDDxgDxXjDXSQNFKAnkPGs1wmIPcixgXqDtFV0CfIkcPpE_DhmbP8VXQEguHoBW3pVWD3TGPKUft-GuK9S2WUM5Tz80qvRjDSqtH5bsQb6vz0EP5mb7ktqfKMwQuegfh1Ve6ZqJBWfwLH-CE_t4=&c=97aWwrYaowhsMZFxpBlVb4Z58u_IbvSZ5u4n-MxFq2449ZsT4-IKAA==&ch=5mKlf1ttnZkfHZSIZvPQcj3UYEr755IoXyxKncaMI0zNZ7XbE6aaEw==> .

 

The Loop Goes Global



Mindshare is expected to make its proprietary real-time marketing (RTM) system, The Loop, available to its global network in time for the World Cup. The expansion coincides with agreements with Twitter, which will give select Mindshare clients in The Loop markets access to Twitter Live Studio services. Mindshare launched The Loop <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001aCA1GqUvbfGh3XNhvntoZ658oDAU039pb09MHwseN3Yfc4jiSmsUXOkv-jGyWgVFFnsUb-fcNYM9gzc7mYzV0zsUOLRMZhJWP65a8ucRumGDZBfU4S3HUI1zTCQFMUOohM2CNRfS0IzYrD0isOj-gVA4baKTIpHhGb22gWhxho-mU0yJsUOQ_8dPY8ihI7vzEAFMI5-AIMr5QOBpNQMaQf_I_XWliFIR9v6ZxLRezOW1gaJrVF1kybDLvyFZY1CoKjcjZtnlC-5WgIHvLMjYbw==&c=97aWwrYaowhsMZFxpBlVb4Z58u_IbvSZ5u4n-MxFq2449ZsT4-IKAA==&ch=5mKlf1ttnZkfHZSIZvPQcj3UYEr755IoXyxKncaMI0zNZ7XbE6aaEw==>  in February, and the system incorporates paid media into the RTM process alongside owned and earned media. Read more via MediaPost <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001aCA1GqUvbfGh3XNhvntoZ658oDAU039pb09MHwseN3Yfc4jiSmsUXOkv-jGyWgVFdj_qOcObCZAsT1WBvSiqqb86zUPYgMIguabHbic3X1Pu3qUJg_XcdvXDq1z_AZmOfUmaTMs-SOd7ZhCmHG9dWpDEKhI7-YPR_J_RX14d0v1N4TFyOCKGTcV4xwKZy0ZrfyKEd503UoYfaIbxpnN4zpDMZO5SHQiESfB3PIRhhwPYi5oe_xvHbVX_TUxoM5_nb8BGKw7I9j0=&c=97aWwrYaowhsMZFxpBlVb4Z58u_IbvSZ5u4n-MxFq2449ZsT4-IKAA==&ch=5mKlf1ttnZkfHZSIZvPQcj3UYEr755IoXyxKncaMI0zNZ7XbE6aaEw==> .

 

Daddy Of Ad Tech

 

In the recent string of data-centric, marketing tech acquisitions, IBM and Silverpop are among the largest. Writing for The Drum, Andrew Moss structures the data thusly: "IBM wants to rule the increasingly important field of permission-based automated marketing and social CRM, and is determined that Oracle, Adobe and Salesforce.com don't. ... This will make troubling reading not just for Big Blue's rivals, but the big digital marketing and CRM agencies, who will now not only have to compete with each other for clients, but the daddy of all tech giants." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001aCA1GqUvbfGh3XNhvntoZ658oDAU039pb09MHwseN3Yfc4jiSmsUXOkv-jGyWgVFpNnUrdumDZ1w_t9Wm0MVrOQF6pnaET3jxwhXijUzrlajnIhX3D737faL1y1f9eNWp1UOWl8M3SiWnvI34OoqAqkuqZE3Ymqy7VgmL4VwdZ1R8A0zXHoGyL9LGhvNsrVLlBayz433neOjYGhRm6nJQbZ59NXD2VQHFFRNXpIj6KUAS-Ziwwn2L10fgOSfCJXP&c=97aWwrYaowhsMZFxpBlVb4Z58u_IbvSZ5u4n-MxFq2449ZsT4-IKAA==&ch=5mKlf1ttnZkfHZSIZvPQcj3UYEr755IoXyxKncaMI0zNZ7XbE6aaEw==> .

 

Reddit's Location

 

For a site that sees an immense amount of traffic, Reddit has not sold ads liberally. Until now, advertisers were only able to place location-targeted banner ads. On Wednesday, Reddit announced that it's extending location-targeting ads to include promoted posts. Reddit ad sales manager Adriana Gadala-Maria said that ads that are location-targeted will be clearly marked and seek to "give advertisers a better way to target their audience."  News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dlPQJ7Jm2yxStbZpnPkHvsKn_84vxrjpllsHTitdsoOcJ8jNbhAFpM9XyOZzGNMm4_hKTMySD37IIw5g2dBoqddngYkK-TSkwyZNN3pqrQUSzxVIolkK0OuLw5VkrB5i5_Qa8sueLk7CMCFo6QAsX-PBDWOg_u4jukcTcKmhxSdKTQZGLAuAZSDt9tA97kX6&c=5nSOyuZlqwlcJ8aFibW74EeIPHm7SYOf-XpbeuB0kP0Vpuu4bNVCOQ==&ch=pNjypQLbXWllphdhYOLeMqIo1Lmf2gpR-w5FZi7KqEEwTbJC6o8d3w==> .

 

Collaborating For Online Video

 

AT&T and The Chernin Group announced Tuesday plans to acquire, invest in and launch OTT (over-the-top) video services, and have collectively contributed more than $500M to the venture. This positions the companies to expand operations in the rapidly growing online video industry, and the focus of the initiative will see deeper investment in advertising and subscription VOD and streaming services. With over 50% of global Internet traffic driven by video, the alliance could broaden the companies' reach across multiple platforms and networks. Read more via VentureBeat <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dlPQJ7Jm2yxStbZpnPkHvsKn_84vxrjpllsHTitdsoOcJ8jNbhAFpGoJVCxYLv8iuG8lOh45VxFY_UNJ9TtQOSFsl50XD-W6Tqou_ml-tvO9dZf0K_nBvbCfFYCrlb4FHMuQnoNoC2rviq9zYs1g671dwrA7Ji9OYiQ8uTWicZTlW7G2laZxTBAgBSvoIVJ3kJIF0yPnioB6JGn4E_PppsNAC8PrLRXd8Wi7b253oIFnjQSHZNwu5MFWG2jhEAzCy6VZj2BibcK6cE7VauzrFxgQuaLZtlFEx4eNKmaY9LGcwIECET2H363xPy8J1UrcGK83ZEYkdbE=&c=5nSOyuZlqwlcJ8aFibW74EeIPHm7SYOf-XpbeuB0kP0Vpuu4bNVCOQ==&ch=pNjypQLbXWllphdhYOLeMqIo1Lmf2gpR-w5FZi7KqEEwTbJC6o8d3w==> .

 

Extending TV Ads To Mobile

 

WPP-owned programmatic platform Xaxis is vying for TV audiences' attention, as viewers largely pick up mobile devices during commercial breaks. According to Xaxis CEO Brian Lesser, "One of the biggest challenges that advertisers have right now, especially when it comes to buying broadcast television, is that up to 50% of people that are watching broadcast television are also engaging with another device." "Sync" is Xaxis' solution, which allows advertisers to serve the same ads that appear on TV screens on mobile devices. AdAge has the story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dlPQJ7Jm2yxStbZpnPkHvsKn_84vxrjpllsHTitdsoOcJ8jNbhAFpGoJVCxYLv8iWesZshSaxKeAXkjSHWo1l0rPLyM8PrQi8z5Ckh8EA5juMFgPiITH5gYQo-OyeSNLl1AifeZiB3fzNmcYXWoVvfFhtUc8QNxI40nuNw39TRDF3ddIqQadix2Yap9NU3LTSvF2gI8Et2PgMapKuovgIjKYOqAcUofqDTO6ojaxrCs1gP_uctCO_w==&c=5nSOyuZlqwlcJ8aFibW74EeIPHm7SYOf-XpbeuB0kP0Vpuu4bNVCOQ==&ch=pNjypQLbXWllphdhYOLeMqIo1Lmf2gpR-w5FZi7KqEEwTbJC6o8d3w==> .

 

Android Takes Lead

 

According to Opera Mediaworks' Q1 2014 State of Mobile Advertising report, Google surpassed Apple in 2014's first quarter for mobile ad traffic. This marks the first time that Android has beat out the iOS platform, hosting 42.8% of mobile ad traffic globally compared to Apple's 38.2%. Additionally, the Google platform increased its mobile ad monetization, up to 33% of all revenue in Q1 compared to 26.7% in 2013's first quarter. The report also details that rich media ads prove most effective. Read the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dlPQJ7Jm2yxStbZpnPkHvsKn_84vxrjpllsHTitdsoOcJ8jNbhAFpGoJVCxYLv8iTKV5BiaibdlrM5W6GXG4klaPl7bzU6QvV1hrbmIRQlr4-kVQ7uWLI6EFFGThHKVPHLEV80vM6S6VmygCVqueY4DhkOZrzrSBryT2US8HBA6s2HIiwWRs8KrppjpxmvfGmTDGj_AwNDY=&c=5nSOyuZlqwlcJ8aFibW74EeIPHm7SYOf-XpbeuB0kP0Vpuu4bNVCOQ==&ch=pNjypQLbXWllphdhYOLeMqIo1Lmf2gpR-w5FZi7KqEEwTbJC6o8d3w==> .

 

Mobile Swing

 

Digital media consumption is surpassing time spent with TV, according to aggregated data from eMarketer, with mobile growth driving this shift. US adults will spend an average of 23% more time on a mobile device per day in 2014 than they did in 2013. Digital video still accounts for a small portion of mobile activity, but social network usage on mobile is predicted to overtake desktop this year. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dlPQJ7Jm2yxStbZpnPkHvsKn_84vxrjpllsHTitdsoOcJ8jNbhAFpGoJVCxYLv8iCxvTBorZFR9eW6ECx_kGDcQO0oASbby-L20h5DHNM446hR9XiOMjxgpXKlLVMVLg8q5eTE71AAAbpyvuQLUxo1Qm1LSV_2ZbRlFBA1QDnvIx7Zo_kYsiLFcPUziBeHK4rCnj3z3pdEdq4QLI9uCoKzVZBV5TsN7wpLUeRN2c7DWs3o5J3AIndhL6q28nrvoteewdD7xx658RYqPgC11fwcY4JJyjb2EkGI8yA4I3rgY=&c=5nSOyuZlqwlcJ8aFibW74EeIPHm7SYOf-XpbeuB0kP0Vpuu4bNVCOQ==&ch=pNjypQLbXWllphdhYOLeMqIo1Lmf2gpR-w5FZi7KqEEwTbJC6o8d3w==> .

 

Programmatic Methods

 

Microsoft's anti-fraud efforts are directed at prevention, detection and mitigation, says the company's GM for display, Greg Nelson. Writing on Microsoft's blog Tuesday, Nelson offers a bulleted list of these efforts, including: "New programmatic methods for detecting fraud based on recent investigations and behavioral signals. These methods include updates to our proprietary blocking, detection, and filtration systems to enhance a complex series of filters that automatically work to identify bots, low-quality, and/or invalid clicks that will not be billed to advertisers." Read the post in full <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dlPQJ7Jm2yxStbZpnPkHvsKn_84vxrjpllsHTitdsoOcJ8jNbhAFpGoJVCxYLv8iDSA6dvi_2je0UxdeYAzCcOzvyi6dg4ufrEYCI5Q63KRcaVhCdMbOUaQ-JijWpwVaYla8tqr7S4miKwOjFIcz3_M-COzgZpz2W6oFLaCQAzBuQ_ZCjqQEQTxSCVSXCdCHcYfYJ_CmvAdMsr9ck4X87S6UkPu7Iq1LLwWvl-RxJRrt1OprcbaDY23nI23RF2RF1Ujc9GJ0WbGQew30Rr2XWUHFPmLCp0pN&c=5nSOyuZlqwlcJ8aFibW74EeIPHm7SYOf-XpbeuB0kP0Vpuu4bNVCOQ==&ch=pNjypQLbXWllphdhYOLeMqIo1Lmf2gpR-w5FZi7KqEEwTbJC6o8d3w==> .

 

MediaMath Adds More Exchanges

 

On Tuesday, MediaMath's biz dev strategies continued to percolate via the company's OPEN partnerships program. The latest press release positions "premium" and "video" as the critical keywords. Through MediaMath, DoubleClick Ad Exchange and BrightRoll will let marketers opt to buy premium video placements with publishers such as Yahoo, Microsoft and Cond Nast. Read the press release.  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dlPQJ7Jm2yxStbZpnPkHvsKn_84vxrjpllsHTitdsoOcJ8jNbhAFpGoJVCxYLv8i-yc7Ug8UJLYQH09743a4yycfe3dmaI_Xsn7-rJwcAE2KzHZEi_wubOXaMAyWfiNr9rupcegW4v4Nhdu1v2rvTm7woczw6AVa-ARv3LTMZd9dR3pDd8h0qXmJF5HXlr74AeK1Q-KEy7CNWGdfTIIgurFITukvXXVnNDJvZQbLuMB4C3e69qLW-th58f4r-s2aMkwtE3TMTbjeZKaQoJQHv3ODzNYmgMI3p5H7KVIYWwlboyOgwcTu4oKFDdmnyWl5&c=5nSOyuZlqwlcJ8aFibW74EeIPHm7SYOf-XpbeuB0kP0Vpuu4bNVCOQ==&ch=pNjypQLbXWllphdhYOLeMqIo1Lmf2gpR-w5FZi7KqEEwTbJC6o8d3w==>

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00195P_Dw_JmDersxjCzceOT4roD7nCbJKmCzG9fQKcFLTV0Y1O3EQFz9BWGMlCAvFDuBgEJI8WGUif_h9H5NNXkVRp--UYhPs6INxXcjA-_42zhyzIzx9Fa_R1XAy1RM9oakYosipIbUuNSgq06fo1LWF7FcpyFGLkaNWr2polxPogF1r_R67OZZWhkUaDm_vI&c=29k2e9EVHqVVlUbAnmdCHxzhE9fyda8Q4DLtlA-u-yOEpFfWXKy9bg==&ch=a5aNEnDBPpKG2OzkfzFn1f7HNlWEuRpf93dIxGKNaxZrWM9O8mlUIQ==> .

 

Mobile Supply Deals

 

As mobile gaming rises in popularity, Google and Apple are cutting deals with companies that develop popular games. In exchange for early releases on iOS and Android platforms, game makers are being offered prime marketing spots in app stores. This brings Google and Apple into closer competition, and an article by the WSJ <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00195P_Dw_JmDersxjCzceOT4roD7nCbJKmCzG9fQKcFLTV0Y1O3EQFzztjjqm8zfvcBoX9Z6WkNgf046D1_-qpchon85uy1i-L3ZWmtvC0PA3wBVVoxI_Vq3wwx8FdYLY2hppJ7qEggufd8k70dyHlMxTwdj5c96iJLwAVmFW_rAohVW9pk-rttpCDrzIgMAYfhrIprkk6lqTGWMdLke-0NPgKKqQplbb6BjZuko1t5ysNFYmr5G8Nig0kyjUl4kf7vy8XuWo1pJ8FQYHE28_qBv_V26iXDJsm920BJRbPNrk=&c=29k2e9EVHqVVlUbAnmdCHxzhE9fyda8Q4DLtlA-u-yOEpFfWXKy9bg==&ch=a5aNEnDBPpKG2OzkfzFn1f7HNlWEuRpf93dIxGKNaxZrWM9O8mlUIQ==>  reports that Amazon and Microsoft are also joining the race for exclusivity. Gigaom has the story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00195P_Dw_JmDersxjCzceOT4roD7nCbJKmCzG9fQKcFLTV0Y1O3EQFzztjjqm8zfvcRCKNIt4LAxmFmKmViVrYgB6-a4SFbp86dPVZyI83KOqVFK3V_UzuYy3bnReKZ31R9zYroyw2ewhr9EN6nhN9tnpN-RSTjc0MdkXZlK_EXMY7Q5k1nrEsLHQn8u8OyI1IqNj95MP7MaFiE26HgHsOXqdoznBecmn4MckGxX1ube_Tuf-B1Zc2TQXFuR3y8yb7P6X8PTJuBnciL-LPnps8gp1sh353qPBfV7k6_X9649E=&c=29k2e9EVHqVVlUbAnmdCHxzhE9fyda8Q4DLtlA-u-yOEpFfWXKy9bg==&ch=a5aNEnDBPpKG2OzkfzFn1f7HNlWEuRpf93dIxGKNaxZrWM9O8mlUIQ==> . Expect more mobile ad impressions from a select club of proven hit-makers.

 

Facebook's Mobile Ad Network



Re/code reports that Facebook is set to unveil its first mobile ad network by the end of the month. Facebook was rumored to be toying with this endeavor back in January, yet the development was stalled as the company lacked any mobile ads of its own. However, mobile ads generated $1.24B for the company in the last three months of 2013, with a large chunk of that sum coming from "app-install" ads.This move brings Facebook into the arena with Google's AdMob network, and Twitter is not far behind with app install ads of its own. Yet recent news of deepening location data could make Facebook's mobile ad network more valuable. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00195P_Dw_JmDersxjCzceOT4roD7nCbJKmCzG9fQKcFLTV0Y1O3EQFzztjjqm8zfvc0mIPBsP8O6jg1VMNJWEhlCdUhm-hEkoiuNG2IZo2UW1DzslCkoKZutaUtpCZPmhD2ooPvAZo1I8jkg50_Xhx0NwrobhukTSEvTqHPZd3wkA-2oRLpcdR4rx5pqpeGh7qLYRc5f5JP0b-05a-yd3sjvt5IPJyJwOOJPs5PktArvqqhG_tXW2nrv35waPLMiOPY1pX1DlCi32Ih2dx_uxZzQ==&c=29k2e9EVHqVVlUbAnmdCHxzhE9fyda8Q4DLtlA-u-yOEpFfWXKy9bg==&ch=a5aNEnDBPpKG2OzkfzFn1f7HNlWEuRpf93dIxGKNaxZrWM9O8mlUIQ==> .

 

The Bot Army

 

Bots are evolving, according to Nick Bilton in the NYT, as social media sees a surge in bought followers and likes. While computer-generated content used to be easy to spot across social media platforms, bots are beginning to exhibit more humanlike behavior online (for instance keeping regular hours and adopting fake names). "There's an evolutionary process at work where companies have built better spam filters, which has led to better bots," sad Tim Hwang, chief scientist at the Pacific Social Architecting Corporation. Get the full story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00195P_Dw_JmDersxjCzceOT4roD7nCbJKmCzG9fQKcFLTV0Y1O3EQFzztjjqm8zfvcdQfjA7FYbtAvvs5HUiXldK99AAMZLeIoEDMbVZN-jEduN9ciB_ZZPJ5ZY0ySl4FtvabZASIdqbnq0ZvjavSeayWuTvswuWebvUu2MadT1BOa8PQ8keM0nEoCuv_Vn9WFtH6ljTZ3cOxx1QdnAxsU2DOhF4gFdBQODkBy0H_l_QObvFKIHHkNVblR0aj9Rfd2&c=29k2e9EVHqVVlUbAnmdCHxzhE9fyda8Q4DLtlA-u-yOEpFfWXKy9bg==&ch=a5aNEnDBPpKG2OzkfzFn1f7HNlWEuRpf93dIxGKNaxZrWM9O8mlUIQ==> . 



TV Beats Digital In Q1

 

Despite digital's organically growing rates, TV ad spend drove Madison Avenue spending in 2014's first quarter. Several major agency holding companies combined media buy data through Standard Media Index, yielding an 18% spike over 2013's first quarter. Of course, the Olympic Games, NCAA college basketball tournament and Academy Awards all helped drive TV ad spend in Q1. Radio was the only other major medium to expand in Q1, at a rate of 3%, while newspapers, magazines and out-of-home all declined. MediaPost reports the findings <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00195P_Dw_JmDersxjCzceOT4roD7nCbJKmCzG9fQKcFLTV0Y1O3EQFzztjjqm8zfvcgJoN0h9pD1InvLX_zopppXncqsPPaA3AS0apTMQdS55ASr-hluE0dlpamvR45oMn5UL3pa5deWucfDmJ-nBQLqinuwmnv95lQ-ns2ljn2PUqfRBjLpLtrGzNnN3BLonGdbnxATsdrPVpBT5kgem-OE3qh7dS-pz7jvm3stlco9H70fr3gP09kVrrWk2j6ZRfV7JG7cu99LwrLzgtMiZioXgreuzSClyV&c=29k2e9EVHqVVlUbAnmdCHxzhE9fyda8Q4DLtlA-u-yOEpFfWXKy9bg==&ch=a5aNEnDBPpKG2OzkfzFn1f7HNlWEuRpf93dIxGKNaxZrWM9O8mlUIQ==> .

 

SMB Mobile Ad Revs



CEO Dipanshu Sharma of location-marketing firm xAd (featured in March <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00195P_Dw_JmDersxjCzceOT4roD7nCbJKmCzG9fQKcFLTV0Y1O3EQFz0aTZ1lyOk7G4aPJbZfdDlzC1xQH4YKrdx_FlEwY18XdzHg4iZQEP3X2ITrkRU5VkH6H5GPtvShRChcLY1ZnPvDDQ3DLC4vCSwnTiw_qtkbOa_XO72-YLFF-Gz_L-zldt3-CGnDU-F7-p1Ne3xoCyC6HB1xPayr6_ztEXO771f9GgV-Colihf5j-SNWmKdZEhIpDsJQJH48qvkj7fB33XNMHONaIqApOGA==&c=29k2e9EVHqVVlUbAnmdCHxzhE9fyda8Q4DLtlA-u-yOEpFfWXKy9bg==&ch=a5aNEnDBPpKG2OzkfzFn1f7HNlWEuRpf93dIxGKNaxZrWM9O8mlUIQ==>  on AdExchanger) spoke with Street Fight about the importance of small businesses in ad tech and the challenges of securing recurrent revenue for mobile. xAd seems to be doing all right by the SMB as Sharma delivers (what are likely) gross revenue numbers: "The majority of our revenue, more than 50 percent of the $65 million we did in revenue was from small or medium-sized businesses. A lot of people don't realize that there is a huge, huge market. Also, last year we generated 14 million phone calls to small and medium-sized businesses. Google generated 60 million, so we're almost a quarter of the total volume." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00195P_Dw_JmDersxjCzceOT4roD7nCbJKmCzG9fQKcFLTV0Y1O3EQFzztjjqm8zfvcD1fFfHKSssgF603yas7b7HDH5XJVXwgRiXdliZ2oznASjivcT28DMm70mVhqoQBQwchqybQi9hUN5P14i9ecERdU2XWH2LtnnIKxdBJXdBn_KrMEh701A87lE7qwguoCucB-q68g_IXRL0eEpLufvfdtQcMpuWOvx1lV4ufG_EZJecCs8O_zqGChj6U-ew2Fx7QWMUPEbswDQ_iGLforB8ix4ekkbVZg&c=29k2e9EVHqVVlUbAnmdCHxzhE9fyda8Q4DLtlA-u-yOEpFfWXKy9bg==&ch=a5aNEnDBPpKG2OzkfzFn1f7HNlWEuRpf93dIxGKNaxZrWM9O8mlUIQ==> .

Tracking Location

 

New location tracking capabilities (announced last Thursday <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pLHBnIDvfaJVPJe1GsL5W6cycaS3N7GWOWM1LhG4QpmtLvndf3CbtMvSYOOVQI1-qzsK0bMwx9dkjZTyvQVtrY41-z45bGViHV3S_ft7-5AgklMl81G-o3PbauJX14KL9LHm87604JbM_iTwWKj6vrF516KJf3UWiDbHQ_fRQ-A1VgefuisZuWGAppW9HRVM28jQJfOCT7z55_hP0DyCRBRxL5hAzshk&c=9tcXyTcYpQSOn8Idzq-A-I4fKGzrbAcsgmUt6hjVIFlD5RjQBzCkrw==&ch=HVtDG5fIS5N9N7x6Qqu4Xbx2gYJ8jlGuQvOyEK5oWpdlmjwPH1xm6w==> ) through Facebook have the ecosystem - and Facebook users - wondering when it will be used for ad targeting. TechCrunch's Josh Constine posits, "Imagine if the ads you saw in your News Feed were for restaurants or shops a block away. Those would surely be more relevant to users and more effective for businesses." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pLHBnIDvfaJVPJe1GsL5W6cycaS3N7GWOWM1LhG4QpmtLvndf3CbtMvSYOOVQI1-AUdAIUY9v6L9TxWPn9cHBiodDl_gsPWrot7dqeg7YMOQlkHzqTyigfwwrf6I4q6bYW2PbI9nrYaagm3D21Y-EJEUq6uCyLBRqv_A-p8TShbQVpdau4kT5kk7LiAY4QQIUKC4rOHMrKfQSFbRpUobzBcJCnUkqcJyHIKu9_IFt7M=&c=9tcXyTcYpQSOn8Idzq-A-I4fKGzrbAcsgmUt6hjVIFlD5RjQBzCkrw==&ch=HVtDG5fIS5N9N7x6Qqu4Xbx2gYJ8jlGuQvOyEK5oWpdlmjwPH1xm6w==> . And, read more reaction to the new feature on Pando Daily <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pLHBnIDvfaJVPJe1GsL5W6cycaS3N7GWOWM1LhG4QpmtLvndf3CbtMvSYOOVQI1-RUDfJZ8rmIDxKmqNZkF1arq7L0GFHIb-YLCI93DuTxxHcyb7rBdoMLFuSrUqdWWB44mcULWFGsD_K6z2KY-IbfOZVe5SngSdjbhlkeH9W7StPSSq-D-SsHpuTZ-__snahBIrOaY9HDhWB0O4CDUCOP-OLqhZ_YOaiWmogmmKZoB05-AYTm__6k3pkcXgmBgXTF65Dhd62-O4AfT7_cTKQKgpDk2GyZlh&c=9tcXyTcYpQSOn8Idzq-A-I4fKGzrbAcsgmUt6hjVIFlD5RjQBzCkrw==&ch=HVtDG5fIS5N9N7x6Qqu4Xbx2gYJ8jlGuQvOyEK5oWpdlmjwPH1xm6w==> .

 

Let's Measure

 

Reporter Emily Steel suggests in the FT that the cable TV cord is being cut in favor of IP-based video delivery, and new data from Tremor and Nielsen echoes that view. The companies say online viewers are enjoying 12 hours of Web video daily on average. But Steel adds, "Marketers say they are becoming agnostic about which screens original online videos appear on. More important for them is overcoming the challenge of measuring both the size of the audience and the return on advertising." Read more (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pLHBnIDvfaJVPJe1GsL5W6cycaS3N7GWOWM1LhG4QpmtLvndf3CbtMvSYOOVQI1-_YtxWkSeOITgBDVqNnX-bzCaqzNAy9TH41cJH5CwRjoxfg3O3FtM1jXSYNDlJCzRWDuXssQTmWXLfTEX4KxR7fhpDLAh9FEu_q7uDHDAEhHOLQii_-jvADEKbYqX68KfKbLc4RL82armQOjMzndCKGUuX1YvbM7KXFfPX06AWxtzJ_zmsi8f4A==&c=9tcXyTcYpQSOn8Idzq-A-I4fKGzrbAcsgmUt6hjVIFlD5RjQBzCkrw==&ch=HVtDG5fIS5N9N7x6Qqu4Xbx2gYJ8jlGuQvOyEK5oWpdlmjwPH1xm6w==> .

 

Et Tu, Collective?

 

Collective CEO Joe Apprendi discusses the possibilities of his ad tech firm going public in a brief interview on Business Insider. He tells BI's Jim Edwards that "the company is doing about $200 million a year in net revenues." Edwards adds, "(Collective is) also profitable, and Apprendi is fond of joking that unlike his rivals in the adtech business, his company actually pays taxes because of it." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pLHBnIDvfaJVPJe1GsL5W6cycaS3N7GWOWM1LhG4QpmtLvndf3CbtMvSYOOVQI1-2n6SWwkBye_nYEUxL8ZlVBNo-3RL2T4qeN5L-Ws_e4z2ZLiXnQYvcYOcLJzP1PNwRrc78CJ-_yjPsuLE2MktiwudfbB09lfIHU1LLGgt8BZ0oNO4BOsXlaBPTE2rsvTSIOXzP9y9YAYx1M_6Spwdk8z9pErTqMIsQvIFzn2FjLM=&c=9tcXyTcYpQSOn8Idzq-A-I4fKGzrbAcsgmUt6hjVIFlD5RjQBzCkrw==&ch=HVtDG5fIS5N9N7x6Qqu4Xbx2gYJ8jlGuQvOyEK5oWpdlmjwPH1xm6w==> . 



Mobile Brand Advertising

 

Onswipe's co-founder and CMO, Jason Baptiste, shares some insight for any startups or publishers looking to develop mobile brand advertising. His tips center on selling around better user experiences, focusing on brand metrics specific to each campaign, locking down repeat buys and shifting high-impact units into programmatic channels. Read more via VentureBeat <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pLHBnIDvfaJVPJe1GsL5W6cycaS3N7GWOWM1LhG4QpmtLvndf3CbtMvSYOOVQI1-ohJmjX9U3jvrIQVXVbrnNaVRGiisjH2Lb3eaPCUhorejk171RsDjVyAcqA4OTL72mcGoojL-iimvBs3F_Igkw3NBPtgWPBTAKuRbWa3ru4ymlPvSYd2Wn8vleyk6CCUa8H0q2vPqMsg22BRKU7SvsHBBW9xRAgB2RQtmy4zHS2gRO_AKMRzFWWSdVCUdFLkM7elUH1PwOQq-4Rkk8eOWEw==&c=9tcXyTcYpQSOn8Idzq-A-I4fKGzrbAcsgmUt6hjVIFlD5RjQBzCkrw==&ch=HVtDG5fIS5N9N7x6Qqu4Xbx2gYJ8jlGuQvOyEK5oWpdlmjwPH1xm6w==> .

 

Less Organic Reach, No Problem

 

According to a recent study by Nanigans, Facebook advertising climbed by 83% YOY in Q1, and advertisers are shifting their focus by allocating 81% of desktop ad spend to the news feed. The study also shows that with impressions down 17% QOQ and 48% YOY, impressions have a higher value. As Nanigan's data set draws from major brands, these findings might not be indicative of overall spending. However, the findings show that bigger spenders are investing more money in Facebook ads, despite reduced organic reach. Read on at Marketing Land <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pLHBnIDvfaJVPJe1GsL5W6cycaS3N7GWOWM1LhG4QpmtLvndf3CbtMvSYOOVQI1-mDL1WHy8akRup60mR8r5IaHIu5YgVdvW2LAWLMIqKDKa9BpPrzxHZniDOTQXdPYNulVdjFOtnoCzaiGpl0Po3ajXGFD5-YcWxz2zAshzEe_lVIpJLFQZZkVbbZPlpXPCLewHoIMA5ati4I63u-JLCnninhajF6LoDsbO7FXNSFkmcv-d8Qa14lvw2SNQvbsmOg3YIlBpLuY=&c=9tcXyTcYpQSOn8Idzq-A-I4fKGzrbAcsgmUt6hjVIFlD5RjQBzCkrw==&ch=HVtDG5fIS5N9N7x6Qqu4Xbx2gYJ8jlGuQvOyEK5oWpdlmjwPH1xm6w==> .

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pq1Av1qhQMVfr879RiDP4ZtXiNc6NDvecDdGTDdFVXn0WnC04Jwrq7WngnXM2TPsWLbHTkwOaQzDGJngbth41QkU0LwESNhd8XqvL9zovjh_y_SQZ7Lb0Fx_vVimvtectFnAf-cDo-_IqJl3cs09iHHLopK8OkBdcUkUmzXJz6fRoAaqhswYg00NCk21uXyp&c=sDkYIqAF8G1Up5Uw5rXMk7UzC_3E_oAZ7yovPU5IMe_qPKsOfrGVCA==&ch=J-OFZDIu3k_VEVACUv-jXkdmMyft7VnA6d4LyaYr4-2Qtsp5FB4upw==> .

 

Publicis Groupe's Q1 Report

 

The merger of equals with Omnicom is underway but moving more slowly than anticipated, according to Publicis Chairman and CEO Maurice Lvy. On Thursday, Publicis reported earnings and an organic growth rate of 3.3% for 2014's first quarter. Stats showed revenues increased by 2.2% from 2013. Lvy mused, "Added to the double-digit growth in digital activities and the marked improvement in healthcare, these are good reasons that allow us to feel confident about 2014." Meeting its growth objective of over 4% for the full year, the company said it was on track to reach growth and profitability targets for Publicis' strategic road map for 2018. Read the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pq1Av1qhQMVfr879RiDP4ZtXiNc6NDvecDdGTDdFVXn0WnC04Jwrq2TF5vbK7wJQzu1IU7XKPXRM0-XPbNU2etzetcz-pNSk6Af1laEj_mcCOeE6rs19RhLXRk9p_JJfP0lkgJoJk_k6E8JpDUe9uwusVAYW469fCDdwlZhphG9OGaMpwpx-aAybN32q95yzkTQ5i60L7FRDXGvUdF4cb0_ZbuBH76uEUZ8NaHRBOkj7OZ64Tb4hVVq7N-Bq65my&c=sDkYIqAF8G1Up5Uw5rXMk7UzC_3E_oAZ7yovPU5IMe_qPKsOfrGVCA==&ch=J-OFZDIu3k_VEVACUv-jXkdmMyft7VnA6d4LyaYr4-2Qtsp5FB4upw==> .

 

Nielsen Ratings For Mobile



On Thursday, Nielsen launched the final technical trial of Nielsen Online Campaign Ratings' expansion to mobile. Over the past 18 months, BrightRoll and TubeMogul have fully integrated the measurement suite. The Online Campaign Ratings for mobile will use a similar approach to the company's computer and tablet browser measurement. Megan Clarken, Nielsen's EVP, said that cross-platform measurement across content and advertising will help publishers unlock "the true value of their inventory, and advertisers will know the real extent of their campaign release." Press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pq1Av1qhQMVfr879RiDP4ZtXiNc6NDvecDdGTDdFVXn0WnC04Jwrq2TF5vbK7wJQkRX95jiA2SUtzTS1LAcZV3jgGHUTta6PeFlAjtmcPqxYnlK9TyXivaa-ni19lxT1ZzkOAaV8uvCN7Z-leqD-805E-ZDDSSs9KrpGsgpmAFEoVf6PlLZCcDfbX0AKOSP9QLlaXznBgNK24l4Wlo6lXKnZ4Y54D1jnJSnjjjdWd61L3qvNLXRyqKCDH0kBM2cv2msuB2Z1uD9e2XL24e72n4bq4hmhGdPWWjPEq_BEInnVQjfO0v05yRYL688bzp8H&c=sDkYIqAF8G1Up5Uw5rXMk7UzC_3E_oAZ7yovPU5IMe_qPKsOfrGVCA==&ch=J-OFZDIu3k_VEVACUv-jXkdmMyft7VnA6d4LyaYr4-2Qtsp5FB4upw==> .

 

Beckon Raises $8M


Startup Beckon raised $8 million in a Series A funding round, the company announced Thursday. Beckon helps marketers track ad spend using data analytics, and already works with clients such as StubHub, Converse and Nokia. Of market competition, Beckon's CEO and co-founder, Jennifer Zeszut, said, "The big enterprise players (SAP, IBM, SAS, etc.) have deep data integration and analytical capabilities, no doubt. But they offer classically terrible user experiences and rely heavily on services to deliver, so they have very long timelines (usually measured in years) and very big price tags." Read more via TechCrunch <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pq1Av1qhQMVfr879RiDP4ZtXiNc6NDvecDdGTDdFVXn0WnC04Jwrq2TF5vbK7wJQmtDZ3g5RmowQCmQ7BfWBSEleMojey7j4MoWzQaZUtaXb-7Yac4Hse8jNYvdayyTvx9tbOTntQR3HTpOQAHPzI6_d4MEhhF549h3ZNhuv5xCKFVBuZKEsCEY_fjRn196ERVCREO-5sWCSf2IgaHAFZ5JPBQlJ1TR3WYRgbnYF9X_Fe9NeX80gPrk8XICgrDVXEjoXQon_CL-jva7Vi0z2-V7utg4uToRZR0Y6I0qzaMM=&c=sDkYIqAF8G1Up5Uw5rXMk7UzC_3E_oAZ7yovPU5IMe_qPKsOfrGVCA==&ch=J-OFZDIu3k_VEVACUv-jXkdmMyft7VnA6d4LyaYr4-2Qtsp5FB4upw==> .

Ads On Your Toaster


According to a recent survey conducted by Voxburner, 67% of 16-to-24-year-olds cite data security as their No. 1 concern when purchasing an Internet-connected product. Voxburner's findings showed that only 6% of pollees understood the Internet of Things. Head of insights Luke Mitchell said, "We're seeing young people becoming more worried about their data and control of personal information. Respondents can see that the Internet of Things potentially means more of their life is exposed digitally." The Drum has the story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pq1Av1qhQMVfr879RiDP4ZtXiNc6NDvecDdGTDdFVXn0WnC04Jwrq2TF5vbK7wJQ1mE_wR4-sMk94jdQilbUABiMOyx5V9dPVn0UmkNEwYBANa9ibiPHh8UyeFSha_3Nwd3wAnnFoE9anWWVecHS7uY9WvV6g9AmBwU5sI3uW-Qv5I5zUaV2aMYjKCE2E3vWmz9VGaG4tUIkRD7kbCBtWQHSRjclZrPuUq70H4kGtHeNmeVFvQqGSkcUhSeeU1bxtcHIabudP_caAPtkKIM4hosa-RNCJudgPFHw7YCk2CXzodrNqfqy0A==&c=sDkYIqAF8G1Up5Uw5rXMk7UzC_3E_oAZ7yovPU5IMe_qPKsOfrGVCA==&ch=J-OFZDIu3k_VEVACUv-jXkdmMyft7VnA6d4LyaYr4-2Qtsp5FB4upw==> .


Quarterly Board Meeting

 

True[X] (was Social Vibe) has a few new board members. The New York Times reports that Jonathan Miller, the former CEO of AOL, and Mich Mathews, the former CMO of Microsoft, have joined, along with co-COO of News Corp. James Murdoch. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pq1Av1qhQMVfr879RiDP4ZtXiNc6NDvecDdGTDdFVXn0WnC04Jwrq2TF5vbK7wJQ53rRn91sgMmrYe-vaT7Sx_ZHy0X-zdz3dwHnkZUScXjCaOpa7ysAjPuZNBIbDCUI7RaPFIB7G-X1H6QrsLvx_hH06djroN3O0_KCzGVvC4L4_faLcN2o6IwYtc00oQtii-tRX44IC2rEhfbtT0S2FOC9HOZSAaQuNN5pw0fYLSx11TUGXRosg-XOhMla3HJybw0wmztTgQ8=&c=sDkYIqAF8G1Up5Uw5rXMk7UzC_3E_oAZ7yovPU5IMe_qPKsOfrGVCA==&ch=J-OFZDIu3k_VEVACUv-jXkdmMyft7VnA6d4LyaYr4-2Qtsp5FB4upw==> . Now, there's a board meeting! Related: Read our January story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001pq1Av1qhQMVfr879RiDP4ZtXiNc6NDvecDdGTDdFVXn0WnC04Jwrq8bMemeHJJJN-tWp9VzRca2i_-rlrHAJzM3nmLH78g5DY-Eht0xR7QI_bRtEXdk5oe2G1TaNE_6_7qkqxjX57n97JnrEQBohkufqqhCSEw59ZBzR3zkqn5oniqQCkMzpo01WPE8v5oJCSwdcuIZN7C_eQdU1NbJ0wy9ZfxxisIZib4NGdX70jw3Uz-T6_qrsZ2RJhi6w-Y4g-q_niUi9Pu2bVJd_sHcEfA==&c=sDkYIqAF8G1Up5Uw5rXMk7UzC_3E_oAZ7yovPU5IMe_qPKsOfrGVCA==&ch=J-OFZDIu3k_VEVACUv-jXkdmMyft7VnA6d4LyaYr4-2Qtsp5FB4upw==>  on True[X].

New Mobile Exchange

 

Telefonica and Blackstone's GSO Capital Partners have teamed up to create a new mobile ad exchange called Axonix <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0012WwCXjMk4OOAczA76I7_ZBwFG8M9zEydD_encNHeIONS-fGzyuaIZJPd9dDqmu-zoMkEmaGSZ4GqnoQMg5NuFfH1A9DvwlD_88fUqtJc4oMOiCyQnwMenp4XNAPGGYsiCURRampd-2SKGr-WweSGZA2MXRwSstyQn5wqYIk4KdA=&c=L2c6Ttu2nMJldFxcBZyBTb6f0VcFZJs7S5c2UDr3Hv2yHjRh7Hnxwg==&ch=R8455foNBL62cuKszIQ1pMAKwd8gF68zSzn5jpAAAvhmFrqecxPs7Q==> . CEO Simon Birkenhead tells The Drum, "At the moment in mobile advertising there are very few ways of having verified demographic data. There are lots of companies that claim to offer demographic and location data, but actually once you dig into the details it turns out they are actually just algorithms ... whereas operators like Telefonica have verified demographic data so we can guarantee to advertisers that they are targeting the right people." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0012WwCXjMk4OOAczA76I7_ZBwFG8M9zEydD_encNHeIONS-fGzyuaIZJPd9dDqmu-zJiyArrB3hB7bu2-X5L5xhxX0oNbqUbw2r9BRG4aE9QY8CvuPGIFzwuZ7cfBF0cyQUwoe51Y89PpiM_sRHTg1qzmITEqFRABDk84bJilAw3pB51ainbaEELJ_dnMSW4Se3Vq37HabSi1Q3Ep3TH1WMsdXy6INZt9dpuzIezVXBU4qcHVTRyoiKuCn5Ql0fsysp0ixYoI_S9MmvpUq-fKCmuyNS_x2Q9nGsphotHUHbJ8=&c=L2c6Ttu2nMJldFxcBZyBTb6f0VcFZJs7S5c2UDr3Hv2yHjRh7Hnxwg==&ch=R8455foNBL62cuKszIQ1pMAKwd8gF68zSzn5jpAAAvhmFrqecxPs7Q==> . A hundred DSPs are already sipping from the Axonix trough.

 

Storm Watch

 

The Weather Co. will announce this week plans to make weather-related data available to Mindshare. Mindshare buys about $29.2B in ad time and placement for its clients and will now be able to leverage weather data to adjust ad buys depending on upcoming weather conditions. Bad weather has long affected consumer patterns, and access to forthcoming and historical weather patterns will give Mindshare analytics for more targeted ad buys. Although Weather Co. isn't charging Mindshare for access to the data, the company said it hoped Mindshare would buy more ads across Weather Co.'s various media channels. Read more via The WSJ (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0012WwCXjMk4OOAczA76I7_ZBwFG8M9zEydD_encNHeIONS-fGzyuaIZJPd9dDqmu-zZGIuSmKYS19gnPU0yIn02N_Nmc9ZF6T3B1KmlUZmsLRkjAE3mylRZ0Qyym-JfMq2XLi69gbCkohqyFrXb-6OUL-J9S2C9veYsxres9Wb1_40RngzaeXY36xRFvpd0uz4Ytp53iAsj5yTsH0Ld9vyYZsmDuP2aiE5GFM-NriKgdixQJOuPnrWZEhAXYCNIekQ&c=L2c6Ttu2nMJldFxcBZyBTb6f0VcFZJs7S5c2UDr3Hv2yHjRh7Hnxwg==&ch=R8455foNBL62cuKszIQ1pMAKwd8gF68zSzn5jpAAAvhmFrqecxPs7Q==> . 



Growing Budget

 

In this week's Drift column, Doug Weaver drills down into the budget-setting process between sellers and agencies. "For every thousand salespeople who show up to help an agency spend an existing budget," he writes, "only one or two ever talk about helping the agency grow budgets or tap into new ones." If ad sellers push harder for increased spend from established clients before budgets are actually set, they may just change how key agencies perceive them. More from the seller swami <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0012WwCXjMk4OOAczA76I7_ZBwFG8M9zEydD_encNHeIONS-fGzyuaIZJPd9dDqmu-z6YP0TlFfUm1_xB2v1zl9cal5-RhOfvw5KMbwxR7ZX-DksNfMstz2DAD5HJJ6Xjz2uP9Gf6jRZGZdTKrwkRAH2yB4-PTYJBNC9CfgX3OZL0pJktQqhOZwhbX2CcA9NwmfNuwGryCJgZU=&c=L2c6Ttu2nMJldFxcBZyBTb6f0VcFZJs7S5c2UDr3Hv2yHjRh7Hnxwg==&ch=R8455foNBL62cuKszIQ1pMAKwd8gF68zSzn5jpAAAvhmFrqecxPs7Q==> .

 

ComScore's New Brand Metrics

 

ComScore announced Wednesday its latest in actionable brand metrics for mobile ad campaigns across smartphones and tablets. Through vCE <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0012WwCXjMk4OOAczA76I7_ZBwFG8M9zEydD_encNHeIONS-fGzyuaIZJPd9dDqmu-zfCu7jxDOYYJuvcqmOGHIoJ0opRJwkllG-hXySd7erh_g2mvBQxjn2vATXZyfLBRg4E0-21OyFG6FJSM0GTrsphymQysKjqssPfkStRL6qfG4RjUGFNguIr8we8V3fDtHyeioIpvzPSck-hWemytZC770MC9fceyfGti3pagcihgquDm4TsRUWEeGVuGxECGJ&c=L2c6Ttu2nMJldFxcBZyBTb6f0VcFZJs7S5c2UDr3Hv2yHjRh7Hnxwg==&ch=R8455foNBL62cuKszIQ1pMAKwd8gF68zSzn5jpAAAvhmFrqecxPs7Q==>  Mobile and vME Mobile, publishers and advertisers can now access demographic delivery, reach, frequency and GRP metrics across multiple platforms. ComScore's CMO Mark Donovan explained, "More than half of digital media engagement is now spent on smartphones and tablets, but mobile advertising is currently just one-sixth of the digital ad market. Mobile's ability to realize its potential depends in large part on the ability to measure its performance, especially in relation to other media channels." Read the press release.

 

Video Touch



AOL.com has added a very video-heavy touch to its homepage - a 24/7 video player equipped with recurring content. It seems AOL has decided to walk the talk - particularly since the company, which recently went through a rebrand <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0012WwCXjMk4OOAczA76I7_ZBwFG8M9zEydD_encNHeIONS-fGzyuaIZJPd9dDqmu-zwll88o1gDxgXbK-2L4G8XEkBobgmiE4jikYAJnQA1bg_p7kzW6aAaLnkQmM9TBpKbKnC1hDY7isle6AqGxBI_pwiBlRUBsA097lkeagAy6H62In3NRs5CDN7ayCeIBMNoe_pXBsB25W3EHnwwuQl3271u2gDZZJ2dkuqI6Vh-kocEOUGMFMAW2Cg3oqML8DkUqPS5ovzHgU=&c=L2c6Ttu2nMJldFxcBZyBTb6f0VcFZJs7S5c2UDr3Hv2yHjRh7Hnxwg==&ch=R8455foNBL62cuKszIQ1pMAKwd8gF68zSzn5jpAAAvhmFrqecxPs7Q==>  to replace "Networks" with "Platforms," preps for its NewFronts where video will take center stage. AOL President Ran Harnevo recently told <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0012WwCXjMk4OOAczA76I7_ZBwFG8M9zEydD_encNHeIONS-fGzyuaIZK0n_5FnIPHDmbe-53Prpa-2K76HvrMK8bKYvOztybZEEadDMB9jqWTBZkmCjQK8vYmsdjCm2l5wRfSWm0e6iFh-NXTeHvsirzuWva9CvzA9J92i4kPCv8B0mpu6LRrh0ch-NLe_w_PSJufHbavlSXivskVzM5B2PSu1pS4NZhGa3Sf-ZmmNXnKDoYPKtU6S248t-jzG-qxlO3ybV3VpMnT-zGSf6CcqffFXa0h1Y-SA&c=L2c6Ttu2nMJldFxcBZyBTb6f0VcFZJs7S5c2UDr3Hv2yHjRh7Hnxwg==&ch=R8455foNBL62cuKszIQ1pMAKwd8gF68zSzn5jpAAAvhmFrqecxPs7Q==>  AdExchanger, "As consumers expand into tablets and OTT devices ... AOL has decided to experiment with new content formats." AOL also has inked programming deals with HSN, ESPN, WWE, Conde Nast and Simon and Schuster to expand licensed content. Read Ad Age <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0012WwCXjMk4OOAczA76I7_ZBwFG8M9zEydD_encNHeIONS-fGzyuaIZJPd9dDqmu-zvd4h3LgQfx_o4edFlBLE7Zd6CRoro_yeYmyu2pFThC87iFFVwsfbyJMQ8lTStaBHo1aVPLwiDVrOWJx0O2v5lsQnyMrvyl3qrchCVRDPw8SZFdlOgJ6tZ1819PE5yA7fVRnSmhen3oIN214DCYUeJx9EFjX24aDMOCowMlbMycIyohZtu5ZclT5zYODIylub&c=L2c6Ttu2nMJldFxcBZyBTb6f0VcFZJs7S5c2UDr3Hv2yHjRh7Hnxwg==&ch=R8455foNBL62cuKszIQ1pMAKwd8gF68zSzn5jpAAAvhmFrqecxPs7Q==> .


Integration Challenge


According to an Adobe exec, IBM's recent acquisition of Silverpop could prove problematic for marketers using Big Blue platforms because of "silo problems." Oh, and Adobe's Neolane unit is a competitor. Adobe's VP of marketing strategy, Suresh Vittal, takes a swing at Big Blue on CMSWire, "This acquisition feels like an attempt to fix the failings in the Unica acquisition: namely email and cross-channel execution. We think Silverpop is a partial answer that creates significant overlap problems for both Unica and Silverpop clients." Conversely, IBM highlights its history of successful integrations such as Tealeaf and Coremetrics. Read on at CMSWire <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0012WwCXjMk4OOAczA76I7_ZBwFG8M9zEydD_encNHeIONS-fGzyuaIZJPd9dDqmu-zNwIG7jH2N2IcNdWPn2wH9CYzMH4IDXQPIMp0sNGKQTAQlF_b4YIuNwak9eLmpf72aejYNxnLQZUKClPTAnTMYw8wyyCUhr2mUznXarFQlDk_MtsY2xYh9ZhKuEjKZcvFRhhu6ChCh25LNKCE8QRPWHOxgbAh1KkPIT8Zlb98NrACx1mq5LycQOM4IyodkhakshgPPP9HezLS5zygXjFAzpJbxfwCx94U72ssOe5tj0A=&c=L2c6Ttu2nMJldFxcBZyBTb6f0VcFZJs7S5c2UDr3Hv2yHjRh7Hnxwg==&ch=R8455foNBL62cuKszIQ1pMAKwd8gF68zSzn5jpAAAvhmFrqecxPs7Q==> .


Planning Programmatic

 

Kantar says it will publish avails for "programmatic guaranteed-direct and private marketplace inventory from various third-party buy-channels, such as SSPs and other vendors that facilitate the automated buying of premium publisher inventory." The SRDS.com planning platform will be used, according to a release. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0012WwCXjMk4OOAczA76I7_ZBwFG8M9zEydD_encNHeIONS-fGzyuaIZJPd9dDqmu-zZT2NvNOv2ksOMk4VZnISujIKPT6oCdCDv2ABFHYzc0x-doMregFa8TrDkgVc-b4UW2cAW7zOkfLcqHELARUfJeDjf-gKqDE2cqXNh5jIHiF_i5R5EYb8y_m6yksmbuLPrwFGtvI1ewGNzW5KogC4CwsJ3G483tk5&c=L2c6Ttu2nMJldFxcBZyBTb6f0VcFZJs7S5c2UDr3Hv2yHjRh7Hnxwg==&ch=R8455foNBL62cuKszIQ1pMAKwd8gF68zSzn5jpAAAvhmFrqecxPs7Q==> .
