 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001exlpLr79mlPST4KZX9glzwchoV-MV_CMY5kylMFfK1n-TB156jSQfgoEyUSTFcyQkebRBUqbw35mi1ZQeVBiX15_-phniW2tGTs-QBeAEhhvJcHDk7_g1mhWMFHIa4xpeJ_O8yC6fU8W7hhtvDFVpnFFixxe5QLLrWyj75QOk4um-JJc0y75SJeE9RR0DGS9&c=SM0FvwOhm3eMv9puShIpjuJCM8SzOHvqh8sL1cIA4y8QGTInK5spMQ==&ch=mBn6aq-OTpWsiyUyPSk-18qdvP1hXDAQWroke8Te7484vjy8SOEbvQ==> .

 

Gmail TOS Change

 

Google has frequently been criticized for scanning user inboxes for ad targeting and other purposes. Google counters automated screening is part of the email delivery process. On Monday it updated its Gmail terms of service and one line clearly states that content analysis supports "customized search results, tailored advertising, and spam and malware detection." Context still reigns in the inbox. Read more via Reuters <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001exlpLr79mlPST4KZX9glzwchoV-MV_CMY5kylMFfK1n-TB156jSQfvNYgW8lbaHIs2OxLpmxmXDZkf9l8fQGSvsuiiuaKylxbeR1AjPOvQ3OgiZRC6zuczRh4XBGdHMeHBFjAOh2BmAx3EyYYLRHD1mdE5wtqPzer1EKIEAUt8rQaQIZhFwJfbOkXYTiz76KJI3MLGgLllhIPDsC60vMYCVfKc-oM-Qp8C4E1qYHMwCAgGtWEXzS9xRYWsJHmnM6&c=SM0FvwOhm3eMv9puShIpjuJCM8SzOHvqh8sL1cIA4y8QGTInK5spMQ==&ch=mBn6aq-OTpWsiyUyPSk-18qdvP1hXDAQWroke8Te7484vjy8SOEbvQ==> .

 

Monetizing The Firehose

 

The acquisition of social data startup Gnip will help Twitter make its data firehose more actionable to marketers. "We'll be able to support a broader set of use cases across a diverse set of users including brands, universities, agencies, and developers big and small," Gnip says in a blog post. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001exlpLr79mlPST4KZX9glzwchoV-MV_CMY5kylMFfK1n-TB156jSQfvNYgW8lbaHIqz4aSz_UaefCy-mLgR62OG0ivxIykgV5v6e2jrE35LkpBstsVuit1VAtisXF9IVP0pdWpOvHromUPovBJfY8oyaTTgu_vDmnJSFvsR80n2_9umIBEMX3FwINANPiGrhA&c=SM0FvwOhm3eMv9puShIpjuJCM8SzOHvqh8sL1cIA4y8QGTInK5spMQ==&ch=mBn6aq-OTpWsiyUyPSk-18qdvP1hXDAQWroke8Te7484vjy8SOEbvQ==>  Those use cases include layering sentiment and other social data into reporting for digital and offline campaigns -- creating a more holistic view into performance. In related social M&A, Bazaarvoice acquired FeedMagnet for $9 million. More. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001exlpLr79mlPST4KZX9glzwchoV-MV_CMY5kylMFfK1n-TB156jSQfvNYgW8lbaHIh2YtH8dvtRQNeDz2cu4SEveDPTG_l2uAENiS-zfO74yMJ_y63xPqmPu0xgx8QHPYriPICOfZ7q2nnaACrQHqHXYkUS2TrsK8fx9H75okXQ274-bj2HY5qcM-ry__Dlk2uMzFda-vTITw9O_KNpGieM1kYPC2bUFOp06tVHgKO7OV0CZXyV55L7K4FyoGTwn0b37CR2CE6W4=&c=SM0FvwOhm3eMv9puShIpjuJCM8SzOHvqh8sL1cIA4y8QGTInK5spMQ==&ch=mBn6aq-OTpWsiyUyPSk-18qdvP1hXDAQWroke8Te7484vjy8SOEbvQ==> 

 

Marketing Automation Funding, Cont.

 

 

Marketing automation vendor Act-on has raised a $42 million round. CEO Raghu Raghaven said the company tripled from 2012 to 2013, and now serves about 2,200 mid-sized and enterprise clients. Competition could come from cloud marketing companies such as Oracle, Salesforce, Adobe, but these giants often target larger and more expensive clients, creating a mid-market opening for Act-On. Venture Beat has the story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001exlpLr79mlPST4KZX9glzwchoV-MV_CMY5kylMFfK1n-TB156jSQfvNYgW8lbaHINfjgC00RLW-GCMqxQS3rGWeeBN9m-VBRxRgrAmXQIj8cMVgDiOt8SJgNh1M11KkOBWMV0TGKUA4TOG3wzo3XgEcsbyLYl-oZcfonOasGVFDhL9ktDp9y-Dj3AfJZKFpB3TyzvKLlgUtJ4OFNin28I6P41DYj43UWr9eWGrgWn4xmMbCAXS3BzWjVRc2M9Md5NR1knLc3tBAmqsOOW14ERN3FOSJDHYDpFU-k7HzBKgI=&c=SM0FvwOhm3eMv9puShIpjuJCM8SzOHvqh8sL1cIA4y8QGTInK5spMQ==&ch=mBn6aq-OTpWsiyUyPSk-18qdvP1hXDAQWroke8Te7484vjy8SOEbvQ==> . 



Licensing Tech

 

Adaptive Medias, which acquired the remnants of OneScreen after tales of  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001exlpLr79mlPST4KZX9glzwchoV-MV_CMY5kylMFfK1n-TB156jSQfvNYgW8lbaHIPTOx4l8Rr1kb27A1ZNy8cePl3hkEtxDOwv-RujTWd0hNCsGMoVk8sKutUMnXIcc_jwYIYD6tJscJVPwnyZZRJEv8zI2odBDladpNivHmSRHxjLfYDV15Wo1CVNCfSzuj7--fr9haoRFIMsenotocvPi72MFSqYfD6efOmlBYnuU=&c=SM0FvwOhm3eMv9puShIpjuJCM8SzOHvqh8sL1cIA4y8QGTInK5spMQ==&ch=mBn6aq-OTpWsiyUyPSk-18qdvP1hXDAQWroke8Te7484vjy8SOEbvQ==> "questionable" traffic were revealed, announced results yesterday for it's advertising platform business. The company "generated net revenues of $1,030,267 and a net loss of $8,462,981 in 2013." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001exlpLr79mlPST4KZX9glzwchoV-MV_CMY5kylMFfK1n-TB156jSQfvNYgW8lbaHIVRYjeBWy0WsNYYdbBR7PWPlsJcUY_KWnRhHYyzCuuQ5kaw3-cHgBMwbZgt4_S9Pbz64V_LKm8VRpkAZ-bsMmK2sRtMwwzRgBKflxTaFx9FaPBILCCwg2viBRVAG1kAStTM2oDVAYOkMH3qGD8STsdbPAuxEP_apw1geka0PYxQl_fhkSaUIy4ZsOCGR8grvOuGiTnoWPjjuW3-KVPwgALBnMBSTN8NwvDTK-LSM6aUS20rAY4m13pg==&c=SM0FvwOhm3eMv9puShIpjuJCM8SzOHvqh8sL1cIA4y8QGTInK5spMQ==&ch=mBn6aq-OTpWsiyUyPSk-18qdvP1hXDAQWroke8Te7484vjy8SOEbvQ==> . The OneScreen tech is only licensed according to the 10-K report <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001exlpLr79mlPST4KZX9glzwchoV-MV_CMY5kylMFfK1n-TB156jSQfvNYgW8lbaHIB3QA7gZup2P3rr4EuusmeC58PvHGuDAZIdngwsKaFn4PHuDRcIU7xa4SM08F4Zc30umTYgIZQ-B_AbjhZ5xY_x7-S6AM4Ug7ghyGXclAZDUYTSZbkXgWJTP2jwqvVMGr1H3etuBFb7HvEgeW3esiK3FFgBAFRW1fHJmyrNAUPk6JCywo4GaPBpapT0gJbGE_DQRMo2ohE5A=&c=SM0FvwOhm3eMv9puShIpjuJCM8SzOHvqh8sL1cIA4y8QGTInK5spMQ==&ch=mBn6aq-OTpWsiyUyPSk-18qdvP1hXDAQWroke8Te7484vjy8SOEbvQ==> : "On February 12, 2014, (the Company entered into a Management Consulting and Technology License Agreement with OneScreen, Inc. The Agreement provides, among other things, that the Company will provide certain management services and non-exclusively license the intellectual property of the Company's wholly owned subsidiary, Ember, Inc. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001exlpLr79mlPST4KZX9glzwchoV-MV_CMY5kylMFfK1n-TB156jSQfvNYgW8lbaHIN8FhD_C9uuFo6yR18zs2cDz_6PTFbWcQO84LfjaVtXIEGZxboXbAayLREXYUDX5bVpHVq3z--RvgmgNqGC8x1dmAmNBBgvrEJQChrjaaQvQ=&c=SM0FvwOhm3eMv9puShIpjuJCM8SzOHvqh8sL1cIA4y8QGTInK5spMQ==&ch=mBn6aq-OTpWsiyUyPSk-18qdvP1hXDAQWroke8Te7484vjy8SOEbvQ==> , to OneScreen in exchange for an 80% share of OneScreen's net revenue. The Agreement was retroactive to December 1, 2013, and extended through March 31, 2014 with unlimited automatic one-month renewals thereafter."

 

Search IQ

 

Visual IQ and Marin Software have paired to offer joint customers more effective paid search strategies. Agency The Media Kitchen is one such customer, and EVP Caterina Bartoli said the tie-up will help clients"better understand the impact of top-of-funnel marketing activities on lower-funnel paid search metrics." Press release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001exlpLr79mlPST4KZX9glzwchoV-MV_CMY5kylMFfK1n-TB156jSQfvNYgW8lbaHIg4mPdRgvTHoIkO_zyd5cjhY9b2QEKmkaPQjkXR3BiEHVx4jnTZJ8j-bywaUGmDIRq6PmLbY119KETPlpX3Cvv6oDSL3hmG2CZuQOT2S1PuUNABDK0A0ftmc5GQYZdLsr7e9ycEAciHFDpAmfiLMDslbL_eauj_4SekTtFmcdU8n9lmQitnb5b3L8WEadQEuAb0ZLo8bQca6atdI4j-jH44m2thSOwOiv&c=SM0FvwOhm3eMv9puShIpjuJCM8SzOHvqh8sL1cIA4y8QGTInK5spMQ==&ch=mBn6aq-OTpWsiyUyPSk-18qdvP1hXDAQWroke8Te7484vjy8SOEbvQ==>

YouTube's (Guaranteed) Re-Do

 

In her first full-length interview as SVP of the video platform, Google's YouTube chief, Susan Wojcicki, discusses her role and says there is a shift in the way YouTube monetizes content. "In the past, YouTube treated all content and advertisers the same, but now it's packaging its top 5% of content as determined algorithmically (of course) in 14 categories and offering that up front on a guaranteed basis to advertisers." Dubbed "Google Preferred," this foreshadows Google's push for the TV ad dollar - connecting TV advertisers with inventory reserve. But at what cost in comparison to premium cable? Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001O4KunTO-GeOgizGasEs_5onxY3LUtosr4maSUX6yahYi8ePDg9REckb3SVPCvG59WdSAqR3Wodnt3vZW0aeMN6NxP2QDphUx4kRDTgwcj1tvvv86xH_-HtRbX4Gkhbfm1T0T0Ly7_ir_99Cblpq5DG76SJ7kRaEtzZNZriA4O1-zzh07NOKdQDWEb4Z1f6IgPIh59hV3AO8mKKThQEt9bWQOKHqq227EvMyNYYJXXGij_YBfL9B52FzoyYoepoXWve5yW_h0GDgrL6O0NWReyA==&c=k10TZS_jWNfWUGCFKPez-ku2sB3S7rt6OO98evJQ3kB0cs5sV8sJoA==&ch=fhliJzs-yGU2w9YAVyhwArpO_TCNnoSlcyKZ0TruCpW3T71nvH8stA==> .

 

Online TV Redux

 

As the TV upfront season drives breathless coverage across the media world, analysts and broadcasters apparently disagree about whether or not digital advertising will take dollars away from television ad spend. David Bank, RBC Capital Markets analyst, says in The Wall Street Journal that "it's all about reach" and argues that online video targets a concentrated and limited consumer subset. ComScore's VP of marketing and insights, Andrew Lipsman, counters that multiplatform Internet consumption is key. TV beats desktop Web reach, but combining desktop, smartphone and tablet greatly extends digital reach. Read more (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001O4KunTO-GeOgizGasEs_5onxY3LUtosr4maSUX6yahYi8ePDg9REckb3SVPCvG59nCKRMKya35rKeiJRMUqgFpG9cN4hEXsDTZ1Dbw83pV3uJ1oaSZhd-w9xOU8yE3kDzjmeoQ9lGutFM9d0pmEttnz5MwqfhrOn_CRR9mEcGO4KJj7PjGupDbqaqEWQE4yRqwaFeSa5-0VrCZZytrncokgWPNWcTXrYA7EbCvyjca8=&c=k10TZS_jWNfWUGCFKPez-ku2sB3S7rt6OO98evJQ3kB0cs5sV8sJoA==&ch=fhliJzs-yGU2w9YAVyhwArpO_TCNnoSlcyKZ0TruCpW3T71nvH8stA==> .

 

Self-Service


Marketing software company SHIFT announced Monday its next-generation ads self-service solution. James Borow, co-founder and CEO of SHIFT, said, "Now, marketers can utilize their own data on Twitter for CRM matching, cookie retargeting and lead generation card creation to help grow their business." SHIFT's latest offering is part of its Open Marketing Cloud and works to automate campaigns across Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn. Read the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001O4KunTO-GeOgizGasEs_5onxY3LUtosr4maSUX6yahYi8ePDg9REckb3SVPCvG59TeHaU7eh208opn5MRnSj43JMLEEdaqieZ8UJ4SoNl4BDg-9yyfTJ8HCARc9mrEH6PHcuKfsjLSv49VgdVrtDthpFOjDlLT0u_x6un1NYD0EUEBET9XPjOEjhRlIjbo2Ky9yDX_iqUjzU9LFODGIaAO7zKdPv5ZVfjHdH1yprPTN-_4AhTO7bgsgWfNV23cokzxpZZBNS5zb1i1ro4sbK5-8b72fscNLFYuPtHSjliKvHQFvQWlKsV__7MBeL22iU&c=k10TZS_jWNfWUGCFKPez-ku2sB3S7rt6OO98evJQ3kB0cs5sV8sJoA==&ch=fhliJzs-yGU2w9YAVyhwArpO_TCNnoSlcyKZ0TruCpW3T71nvH8stA==> . Got cloud? 



Watering The Patch

 

Street Fight talks to a Patch editor in Framingham, Mass., about the before and after of the site's sale by AOL to Charles Hale and Hale Global. The editor compares AOL and Hale Global: "In regards to reporting the news to the community in Framingham, essentially no difference. ... But there is far less micromanagement from middle managers and Patch HQ. For example, during my 3 1/2 years at Patch before the sale, I had posting requirements that ranged from 5 stories a day to 10 posts per day. Now, there are none." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001O4KunTO-GeOgizGasEs_5onxY3LUtosr4maSUX6yahYi8ePDg9REckb3SVPCvG59i4L7c8pgowlSbZgPHJ7KyWhVYcYQatWdyf85vYbuwiAaCocMQC1xFZ2msrq_WD0cGlCwQpIN47_kevoB4LPk2LtAJJ9Glwi3WRH4n5YOVbkwHXbfOw4BAT0vBv7m5uCa8KPKlh7itw5HWanhTxIshNKlJVDpir6yalYu2KgwrLMFS98htiTplhtGxNwwLJu2QX6ZYQlhvCF3Oe2qlJ9n5BsB92GZMmfk&c=k10TZS_jWNfWUGCFKPez-ku2sB3S7rt6OO98evJQ3kB0cs5sV8sJoA==&ch=fhliJzs-yGU2w9YAVyhwArpO_TCNnoSlcyKZ0TruCpW3T71nvH8stA==> .



You're Hired!

Those scenarios are (a) Using IDFA to serve advertisements within an app, (b) using IDFA to attribute installs to a previously served ad, and (c) using IDFA to attribute a post-install action such as X number of launches, a subscription, or an in-app purchase..." (visit AdExchanger)

TV Upfront Results Loom

 

With the springtime TV upfront season upon us, analysts predict a flatlining for broadcast ad investment. Thursday's IAB annual report showed <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001AtRGO4NyLzQSiSeSeHirojKgB65jJWFcyS9a4z1wuv2EFUGKd2t65JSaUOtwkVQRm_TN5ZeRjkkGI--XojN99KQdl0Drr8arHh0s3m1QYYI1KnSybtM_CSQ2ldO1mOPW2DovYS4yU8IdsJNzFZt62BgYF2k6kcauTL0IiyQxKFvP87SmdxYjtXo5g8tHlmQjugseNmTY9gmjGFMEJwqwTZDOWyfkfV2rdTx_5OpSmg-v0Grgri4zFZWXUi6DOLkT9s326ei6yZGTeICMwpBIxKSwBjhQP7mj5gql0Vcmo8A=&c=ui51EqT8E03-RzQZdVftvR5jMiam1q4C4EpmhJ8eZtojBiBwFbZvtQ==&ch=oWlZUNk2Psjcao0Wx57E0N1NvAZOLNNZza895CBpz2hxJs87sXlqxQ==>  Internet advertising surpassed broadcast for the first time as TV competed with online video platforms such as YouTube and Yahoo. Television networks, however, are optimistic despite sharply declining viewership, and they argue that an improving economy will bolster the market. The WSJ has the story (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001AtRGO4NyLzQSiSeSeHirojKgB65jJWFcyS9a4z1wuv2EFUGKd2t65JSaUOtwkVQRNj2xB-9CfzgfAuj1I4DcBOvmLDndF5p-ysonlb8qOhYpM7lnmLUFFBFZgaPd-mnTz0d9hkS3vDru_4fps5OqPQ5g4WM5Pr0mYaGpALTNqs87A4ifWqylZYhP_QycsKhMB-Pe8I1Z-s_BVCsfg-GekMkdOomIHVEuxw0g6Gvle1SFhO9kyjkBvrwtYqusKXSh&c=ui51EqT8E03-RzQZdVftvR5jMiam1q4C4EpmhJ8eZtojBiBwFbZvtQ==&ch=oWlZUNk2Psjcao0Wx57E0N1NvAZOLNNZza895CBpz2hxJs87sXlqxQ==> .

 

Distributed (Video) Scale

 

AOL video exec and 5min founder Ran Harnevo discusses his company's strategy and the evolution of video on the Web with TechCrunch. TechCrunch's Anthony Ha reports "that when it comes to video, [AOL] may have less name recognition because it's taking [an] more 'open' approach, distributing its videos across a number of properties." To which Harnevo added, "Vimeo and YouTube are easier to grasp because it's big, but it's one product." Read and hear more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001AtRGO4NyLzQSiSeSeHirojKgB65jJWFcyS9a4z1wuv2EFUGKd2t65JSaUOtwkVQRE65BkR1sAG4TxXVMDkqBKYggcscgvHijhlvprMAKCtEUA6ZrdzpMpnylo-bGbta8li7lB66qo03ZS_q146jrAdN4wAUD4zOWGDhrLkLzMLCDZRic3edygJ2FfiRT09b-c69SZgtiKtoPP5RKXH0TLejaW97r3kiF&c=ui51EqT8E03-RzQZdVftvR5jMiam1q4C4EpmhJ8eZtojBiBwFbZvtQ==&ch=oWlZUNk2Psjcao0Wx57E0N1NvAZOLNNZza895CBpz2hxJs87sXlqxQ==> .

 

Native Basics



The Guardian takes a look back to the 2011 presentation that got native trending, when venture capitalist Fred Wilson coined the term. Surprisingly, this presentation was not widely shared on social media. In his talk, Wilson spoke about the fragmented market of digital media and proposed unique monetization systems that are "native to the experience" of whichever digital landscape consumers use. Wilson's main concern for native at the time was scale. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001AtRGO4NyLzQSiSeSeHirojKgB65jJWFcyS9a4z1wuv2EFUGKd2t65JSaUOtwkVQREqKNPMyrmW3IrIZO8kqJ9Iijcb_qx9mrIXgl_gUayHj47G9hEkbpVGAwfrXWloI8Yx1V9Y4f7PyMlYEDU2yiqxIQTb_q8wv42-NGWajw9daiHKJwavw638lA1STDfov47AB_No9NpdVZvqwcuI5uipejFQW4Q7uOoxVQUBKy4S6i4OwcEFjHi_9NwiF2PO-Ibe8Wb3pRebV96QAkQqJOOW7tRJkqwep6AzbTTVPDVEiecQVURq5UDT7HSjNWrv2v&c=ui51EqT8E03-RzQZdVftvR5jMiam1q4C4EpmhJ8eZtojBiBwFbZvtQ==&ch=oWlZUNk2Psjcao0Wx57E0N1NvAZOLNNZza895CBpz2hxJs87sXlqxQ==> .

 

Proximity Marketing 

 

McKinsey & Co. partner David Edelman discusses how mobile tracking technology will impact the offline retailer in an interview with eMarketer. In particular, Edelman addresses iBeacon (learn more) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001AtRGO4NyLzQSiSeSeHirojKgB65jJWFcyS9a4z1wuv2EFUGKd2t65JSaUOtwkVQR19c6rDI37mT073Rpy0tl9X_LdmKlNqiT4FNqzgsZGoGNhJefvJ3f6sMARBG8_Il1VJ9nJlrhnynRwRz-Ckmae0UEzRRC9jQoeEQ3e4KeYAoZL5g5THhqsnTuX09tVHkyNS26g3ve0VjVWLnTVCrpW7OZKUBSsbn0q1OAhrmmr2x_-4h7xQ6momXPuTAoe4gAi5HP0lOW6P8=&c=ui51EqT8E03-RzQZdVftvR5jMiam1q4C4EpmhJ8eZtojBiBwFbZvtQ==&ch=oWlZUNk2Psjcao0Wx57E0N1NvAZOLNNZza895CBpz2hxJs87sXlqxQ==> , a proximity marketing technology similar to near field communication. In general, he admits, "It's overwhelmingly complex for a retailer. There are the various technologies, but the complexity of creating programs, content and the rules to target, and the scale is still small in terms of customers who are actually registered for this." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001AtRGO4NyLzQSiSeSeHirojKgB65jJWFcyS9a4z1wuv2EFUGKd2t65JSaUOtwkVQRS_bA4NDc5PFfNUaaYN2RbGCuKnJ53llXptvDTpQfDHxAglhVOIZvouzKo23h4H8XmotjE1ejqOONFlHRBaYGoIOnCyVMaPq9sKSj7Yluv72sfZKFM2R6QsLwO-VUzW_ff-AEdLrfqM7ZnvDxt-6-CfWN7FdYhPgItvSi8hJNhGIFJ67vQdMggIswbtDfiy_2U7SjLcqrMfk=&c=ui51EqT8E03-RzQZdVftvR5jMiam1q4C4EpmhJ8eZtojBiBwFbZvtQ==&ch=oWlZUNk2Psjcao0Wx57E0N1NvAZOLNNZza895CBpz2hxJs87sXlqxQ==> .

 

Marketing Trifecta

 

Writing for The Drum, MediaMath CRO Erich Wasserman explores the advertiser, agency and ad tech trifecta. Wasserman points to some agencies' uneasy take on programmatic, but makes a case for automation, saying, "this is not a matter of 'either...or', but is instead a 'yes...and'. Brands continue to leverage agency partners for their inimitable trading best practices, cutting-edge tools, and pooled media buying and data expertise. Agencies create new opportunities for brands with the use of programmatic technologies..." Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001AtRGO4NyLzQSiSeSeHirojKgB65jJWFcyS9a4z1wuv2EFUGKd2t65JSaUOtwkVQRmyPpe0Pro_xQAV8g4A05oxhT6L5dE4JsoUfgGsyE5_35KUWuHtqYnTTyhvfSMnz9fPo6JuUMXIu3yiCoAka5yRoVWlMudIM8i6NfymHhpJdeWhpqA4JN-mCTz8bs9mjXBsxo_ukidg5BHmY2khwSWQPhGY3ZgUwPZt1rAbM_QgnrWmtD7FxUMb-9-S68WDnikXvn2QLg0NWR4lhTBW3dfcQMKvCU8DEK0xd8lkmtlZX4anzHtlGLPA==&c=ui51EqT8E03-RzQZdVftvR5jMiam1q4C4EpmhJ8eZtojBiBwFbZvtQ==&ch=oWlZUNk2Psjcao0Wx57E0N1NvAZOLNNZza895CBpz2hxJs87sXlqxQ==> .

 

$1.50 CPM

 

In a post on the Amazon Apps blog, Amazon is crowing about the mobile display eCPMs it's delivering for developers courtesy of a new promotion. Alex Quilci of YouMail tells the blog, "The $1.50 CPM promotion is a 3x bump in eCPM by itself and we're seeing much higher quality ads. We also expect the strong earnings to continue when the promotion ends." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?&c=ui51EqT8E03-RzQZdVftvR5jMiam1q4C4EpmhJ8eZtojBiBwFbZvtQ==&ch=oWlZUNk2Psjcao0Wx57E0N1NvAZOLNNZza895CBpz2hxJs87sXlqxQ==> . This must make "premium" publishers' eyes spin - only a $1.50 CPM? Mobile display yield is not like the good ol' PC-based display days.

 

Beef With Instagram

 

Instagram has yet to launch any publishing APIs, which makes it hard for brands to use the outlet for promotion. Manual posting means marketers can't use third-party tools to leverage analytics and plan campaigns strategically. An Instagram spokesman responded, saying, "Our highest priority is to maintain the community experience on Instagram, while evaluating the tools and metrics that will help brands be successful on the platform - whether that's building through native interfaces or providing via API access." Read more via AdAge.

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001xjYvxzRwrG989VPfv6cHiin9LMecV0AHrtVB6e5av5xEd5gQuD8fTZB_l0rXJL9GjjER9bESDfhwtHtl8Wz2MzurW0dhkiVa-uk94IU7RYz0vf-OfPcy-7kKa9vmjtig6r43OnVdEJ6mAAhQU9Nqgk5b8TGibn-ETWF-WM6AQ1DCUJP9Sash6jalq_6lRRX0&c=179xFu8hI_mvMmu5KgvjiM6Ji_Kp5vRqEsgTKGmS1nSNJEGcTx0z8A==&ch=4hrQnJceBnyztUq8IjiLqR6_zGeN94acnUoG6gzcE8ZH956cZ2zFeg==> .

 

Video Ad Insurance

 

Adap.tv released Advertising Assurance, which it says is a set of measures that seek to protect brand buys in the video marketplace through a collective attack on fraud, visibility and placement inaccuracy. To do so, Advertising Assurance is integrating first- and third-party technologies into Adap.tv's buyer and seller platforms. Adap.tv argues that an open technology platform is essential to combat fraud. Read the post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001xjYvxzRwrG989VPfv6cHiin9LMecV0AHrtVB6e5av5xEd5gQuD8fTTf-5hhl-8iCHA_mnUx5Ww-6xes9FW83eQrZjy84QsoEeFmBSsD5grVe1clT5mhyt5tLMyQff7yn6sK7es5bfN2MLUMo4NmusQM_u--CLaJSeaiPBCyWzWkDn9a35QOkkBFjXJPZKEaz8lDiuwB9NesREiHd-bVvkFN0zOX-prwMthM4bpifushABFrlWCLe35a_RBvjIubI3NqtJ2t0Bc0wv1oVNxKHA4I-PWOvYedB4icfPcNl55gsg9_Sgh3FOAktHi_-B3g_CFjMPIbUNXZ4zoYeaIqciw==&c=179xFu8hI_mvMmu5KgvjiM6Ji_Kp5vRqEsgTKGmS1nSNJEGcTx0z8A==&ch=4hrQnJceBnyztUq8IjiLqR6_zGeN94acnUoG6gzcE8ZH956cZ2zFeg==> . 



When Fraud Is Good For Business

 

Fraud is bad news for marketers, but some ad tech companies are seeing a silver lining. Companies that offer anti-fraud technology are seeing a major uptick in demand. "It's obviously creating a big boom for us," said True[x] CEO Joe Marchese. Other companies combating fraud by linking ad performance to concrete sales are seeing similar interest. AdAge has the story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001xjYvxzRwrG989VPfv6cHiin9LMecV0AHrtVB6e5av5xEd5gQuD8fTTf-5hhl-8iCBULrBkSxHixEADBGNzDwEYIhVeb7hhAee4bWwjp-7hLMx5T8w4CkKvMcJzPqsDWC8ILTZVyJf33CxtFesbNWx498HM__OX-hgLmolQOfj9jTRWaiZj4CJaPKK_4lfFxIjhhVVBhmUesH_zZOrGTPUNUbIJvQY4QHvv3qyOi-6jy3LrkTDdKF_M2AiZnEXdOv&c=179xFu8hI_mvMmu5KgvjiM6Ji_Kp5vRqEsgTKGmS1nSNJEGcTx0z8A==&ch=4hrQnJceBnyztUq8IjiLqR6_zGeN94acnUoG6gzcE8ZH956cZ2zFeg==> .

 

Buying Search

 

Criteo made a small acquisition of a French bid-management search firm called AdQuantic <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001xjYvxzRwrG989VPfv6cHiin9LMecV0AHrtVB6e5av5xEd5gQuD8fTTf-5hhl-8iC9Op0VEzEqazw9saeqD3tGdcLMmJvxcfYGRkaLQzQ5gez5nH_MMhwvRZ4wT7rtWFDZwUi6zW0JQndfEVshqHzbCPmePrOsyHjj8s5yV6U0zc=&c=179xFu8hI_mvMmu5KgvjiM6Ji_Kp5vRqEsgTKGmS1nSNJEGcTx0z8A==&ch=4hrQnJceBnyztUq8IjiLqR6_zGeN94acnUoG6gzcE8ZH956cZ2zFeg==> . TechCrunch received confirmation from Criteo, but no terms of the deal were disclosed and no formal announcement has surfaced. With the acquisition Criteo now has access to AdQuantic's search algorithm, which is steeped in science and math. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001xjYvxzRwrG989VPfv6cHiin9LMecV0AHrtVB6e5av5xEd5gQuD8fTTf-5hhl-8iCOFH5oZl6NbuJRGOFltDfBJLsunoNF6EX-cGTgo5jlfxMW-eQsBHmhbTcemIFpXJ-8pKRq7SLhQ7l2C3nNl8YqbxWpQy0KhkB9ZY2ihIZY5fE5NF0S12kEmrYfx5Asgza7Mm3jCEuigYBCtI7dkfTItBctrftCTJs&c=179xFu8hI_mvMmu5KgvjiM6Ji_Kp5vRqEsgTKGmS1nSNJEGcTx0z8A==&ch=4hrQnJceBnyztUq8IjiLqR6_zGeN94acnUoG6gzcE8ZH956cZ2zFeg==> .

 

Spam Serving

 

It's not necessarily an update on its ads platform, but Facebook is looking to reduce the Page post spam in users' news feeds. A Facebook newsroom post explains one offender -- spammy link posts: "Some stories in News Feed use inaccurate language or formatting to try and trick people into clicking through to a website that contains only ads or a combination of frequently circulated content and ads. For instance, often these stories claim to link to a photo album but instead take the viewer to a website with just ads." Read about the other offenders <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001xjYvxzRwrG989VPfv6cHiin9LMecV0AHrtVB6e5av5xEd5gQuD8fTTf-5hhl-8iCEg8pCVTEws_TEujSWKX4SoTr1qh-nZtzxhhMUx8eSU8iFojUuMDn8AC86MbD1B-j2YAKYxhcZRJrPzoA0UUVICOWVevZkjnChwQW8zlce69s7d6qYCQbadS3oWmOx_RFGe5JvYFF8D2gcQy0UQEgvZKrB7wgY4bouAu1Qn4EelxQB62H28y0ypWGCkMe-rtG&c=179xFu8hI_mvMmu5KgvjiM6Ji_Kp5vRqEsgTKGmS1nSNJEGcTx0z8A==&ch=4hrQnJceBnyztUq8IjiLqR6_zGeN94acnUoG6gzcE8ZH956cZ2zFeg==> .

 

The Paywall of Video Ads

 

Genesis Media raised $6M in funding to support the ad company's main product, ContentUnlock, which allows online publishers to display (mostly video) ads to their readers. ContentUnlock works like a paywall, with video ads surfacing intermittently that are contextualized to readers. Genesis Media is working with premium publishers, such as American Media, Bonnier, USA Today Sports and the Smithsonian. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001xjYvxzRwrG989VPfv6cHiin9LMecV0AHrtVB6e5av5xEd5gQuD8fTTf-5hhl-8iCgyPADM95BbGhoAkulZPmA55bhG8SCOoXzbCNqrGK22jpe27mix2gCikkP5mY_OrmcDgqSurF2KV-8xfymdi87gHbbD1xeEjyA9OziEA43PXZtvP5HC4xRGyGcNTdY2k2As7qps870bEXg78vJFNVYZGBnj3VXvK6&c=179xFu8hI_mvMmu5KgvjiM6Ji_Kp5vRqEsgTKGmS1nSNJEGcTx0z8A==&ch=4hrQnJceBnyztUq8IjiLqR6_zGeN94acnUoG6gzcE8ZH956cZ2zFeg==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0016fb1LdiVJUfN2u04tkedJOWP5he1ajUppoBMt-_1wypG5VvX6wXUI5a7Ug1teD7O94mo9QynYvQ8CBgYsEjG7opJqb7ZSeJfxghLOvOWnsBTbFXE4txtP_2OAfWv-OLICA1z5mbeCDkI1QYZFYJ87aAz71d9EPLppjugy9SltTq-v-FbQH_BsAQK4lhk7oV-&c=vnmc6CnC_LCW0ZHOuSG_ib2-_4PO3zimkkQBWny50cKGR5IVxiJd0g==&ch=HrEyxFG_oqE4Wh7urycZQ1jm8fyWul6JolzC8QXzoHDdMlZiJhPaug==> .

 

Right-Hand Revamp

 

Facebook is giving its right-hand column ads a facelift by making images larger, and reducing the overall number of ads displayed at a given time. Hypothetically this gives advertisers incentive to use the right-hand side again, after news feed ads stole the show. Facebook also reported that advertisers can now use the same image for both news feed and right-hand ads, making the creation process faster. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0016fb1LdiVJUfN2u04tkedJOWP5he1ajUppoBMt-_1wypG5VvX6wXUIx0Yo18b9PA6FD40Om7UMMQKc02iAMeLObT6tkGikIRdfzhMBkmPj362F8TOAnYhewA0i5fBdZmJ8zUaCkLadwZZxYydhcO5K-tJ69qYZ1XHsoL4prc2U8Tx0JeX9mLvQzF_TZmy7Qe9u4YPGchz43WEgOO6Ew1NZa0N7gzLeTkKmBZ5Pa9SY0oLPqxcQTuEMhZNsaot0AB_&c=vnmc6CnC_LCW0ZHOuSG_ib2-_4PO3zimkkQBWny50cKGR5IVxiJd0g==&ch=HrEyxFG_oqE4Wh7urycZQ1jm8fyWul6JolzC8QXzoHDdMlZiJhPaug==> . Will yield increase in the right rail for FB?

 

A Little Less Data

 

In a post on the Google Ads Developer blog, Google AdWords exec Paul Feng announces that Google will "keep search secure by removing the query from the referer on [search] ad clicks originating from SSL searches on Google.com." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0016fb1LdiVJUfN2u04tkedJOWP5he1ajUppoBMt-_1wypG5VvX6wXUIx0Yo18b9PA6wdZK9b6S7i69P0uQ1wguhAHlGvy_U_pyB_Ku5l21_KsGjRnHmYpW5EQylEoqF2h1Q0bFRMdacwTZ7aTvQ6pRYrGs1ee34CJZelu8gnwKRdrLCOenRKO0pVaVBSg2HBL4R8i2pK0ZSVyzvON7VWW0lSJV3JdJIB3QbZ2W2YlIQu7o9LoEB2V_ExbnLKaqTKqB8LvzJY5gir4=&c=vnmc6CnC_LCW0ZHOuSG_ib2-_4PO3zimkkQBWny50cKGR5IVxiJd0g==&ch=HrEyxFG_oqE4Wh7urycZQ1jm8fyWul6JolzC8QXzoHDdMlZiJhPaug==> . Search Engine Land's Ginny Marvin provides a bit of analysis. Read that one <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0016fb1LdiVJUfN2u04tkedJOWP5he1ajUppoBMt-_1wypG5VvX6wXUIx0Yo18b9PA6edZLg5AonCL0hHk2gvUpse5YRS-8FPylmBlZeP_oFOsU1KPUQqYnG9xDX6oQ65Wf589RKtWP98A4Yk9r-1CgwXCdYNeLRai6hHH2DwK_PxddGz8aqndszv9B5l4yy3nvUItDxfy1Fq7-T0lMiATRvEv-SPg3bZEj596Qwo4BJAeBDoOJ_04wguLz1NgCIMev6ao5s7j1S32E__xwlTwgS-1AtAe5QTwVdDqjqfmpgY0=&c=vnmc6CnC_LCW0ZHOuSG_ib2-_4PO3zimkkQBWny50cKGR5IVxiJd0g==&ch=HrEyxFG_oqE4Wh7urycZQ1jm8fyWul6JolzC8QXzoHDdMlZiJhPaug==> . Paid search retargeting through display ad exchanges is now a little less exact as audience segments (pixels) have a little less info.

 

Measuring Mobile



During the 2014 IAB Mobile Marketplace, one Magna Global executive alluded to the difficulty of tracking mobile ads throughout the entire consumer path to purchase. Measuring mobile's impact was a core topic at IAB, with discussion centering on methods such as click-to-call. However, the challenge for mobile may be bridging real-world and digital data, in addition to re-evaluating consumer perspectives when it comes to mobile-first initiatives. Read more via Mobile Commerce Daily <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0016fb1LdiVJUfN2u04tkedJOWP5he1ajUppoBMt-_1wypG5VvX6wXUIx0Yo18b9PA6x6bcj1bGPygkpp18a8y9KefqwHTB3A8yxPEz0jD9QRDS3swLVaaE0f5xxR6f76rmYwKC6WrFB5AhgAsxzOoUwT_mKvczThSGXNyDN-yVsv2lorcNN8lvhPZrJpepvmjbcjm2SRFvwkQizfyWeltf_vGy1vAvUWCp0vlOljxwplFMOP1_MEWDgaBnPQkmGkCMSek8HlVaLvzLoK59kxD-gx5QHrTXgh_Opyt7ESOlE-A=&c=vnmc6CnC_LCW0ZHOuSG_ib2-_4PO3zimkkQBWny50cKGR5IVxiJd0g==&ch=HrEyxFG_oqE4Wh7urycZQ1jm8fyWul6JolzC8QXzoHDdMlZiJhPaug==> .

 

Cross-Device Ad Targeting

 

On Wednesday, mobile solutions firm Somo announced a partnership with cross-device ad company Drawbridge. Somo will adopt Drawbridge's self-service Cross-Device Advertising Platform to run targeted mobile ad campaigns in real time. Drawbridge's technology uses an algorithm that works to match desktop cookies to mobile devices, and the platform also acts as a transparent ad exchange. Read the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0016fb1LdiVJUfN2u04tkedJOWP5he1ajUppoBMt-_1wypG5VvX6wXUIx0Yo18b9PA6mv5JXLOP2CbLwxd-J1UT48qTgDqhynj3Dur5KtNdsmWXhmwpYbOkHTJ-SGwaoKS2SQlj5JEtpKKNrrohzUQe_fjhTmYefjm5gUFvAi_9sQqAsO_EVLsVRO-NneHU1yKXmpQSa8PgHXlUwtRwMO8pHQ==&c=vnmc6CnC_LCW0ZHOuSG_ib2-_4PO3zimkkQBWny50cKGR5IVxiJd0g==&ch=HrEyxFG_oqE4Wh7urycZQ1jm8fyWul6JolzC8QXzoHDdMlZiJhPaug==> . 


Sealing The Deal



In his latest column, seller guru Doug Weaver is ready to close: "Closing isn't a clich, nor is it just a general attitude or posture on a sales call. It's a very specific event within the discussion; a direct question that either does or doesn't get asked." Weaver devises a simple set of questions to determine if your sales teams have problems closing. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0016fb1LdiVJUfN2u04tkedJOWP5he1ajUppoBMt-_1wypG5VvX6wXUIx0Yo18b9PA69Zv5zCIKNDDhN1tf-fC0BjhB9OBaoWE3PHP-vwJ7VlTcPWgD3vBJt16FtJds7vZahOAW08M4on6vuZI7LKmUb_k8cYFXo3oAcxuK58PO-J2ByDZubjjJptOOxFJd_oxI&c=vnmc6CnC_LCW0ZHOuSG_ib2-_4PO3zimkkQBWny50cKGR5IVxiJd0g==&ch=HrEyxFG_oqE4Wh7urycZQ1jm8fyWul6JolzC8QXzoHDdMlZiJhPaug==> . "Oooh dream Weaver <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0016fb1LdiVJUfN2u04tkedJOWP5he1ajUppoBMt-_1wypG5VvX6wXUIx0Yo18b9PA6DRtKmRSJpjDc102G1ps9c1Rtz8FvRlC5eyUj7fQvXyziD8ohUSrZspQOCpLUzflGkhBAiLOJObwEWVw8oA80RKz56B_TMZw2GDOhU6EPUT5tlI9Zg3uXJHlUrEEnTuXgV-pRTcuJ6GsIQEr4K0lA0ZNhYnphfC4I7Jkpu1-hCXS5FNmqehhl_w==&c=vnmc6CnC_LCW0ZHOuSG_ib2-_4PO3zimkkQBWny50cKGR5IVxiJd0g==&ch=HrEyxFG_oqE4Wh7urycZQ1jm8fyWul6JolzC8QXzoHDdMlZiJhPaug==> ..."

 

Google's Hotel Price Ads

 

Signing a licensing deal with hotel-booking software startup Room 77, Google's latest "hotel-price ads" could be a game changer. Google is adding more photos and reviews to its hotel listings, in addition to promoting it's "hotel-price ads" that work similarly to travel search sites. This inadvertently puts Google in competition with some of its biggest advertisers, such as Priceline Group, Expedia and TripAdvisor. The WSJ has the story (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0016fb1LdiVJUfN2u04tkedJOWP5he1ajUppoBMt-_1wypG5VvX6wXUIx0Yo18b9PA6w_k2wK4yJd-DiT6u4gGieMtDTHPpTUB1grp_l7ftfqxdLkam8JtQMC0KOcgWHftQCsImKzBYfVzThZ73gY_6qaAweUTqjd58DswwxVkM9R4BKiC7N0p4EbUip8s8k-bJ0bTaAbQNx0ban06suhfcXLq-rYOFwyBp1CY5N47mOpYPvpmn5lShgxK82thF5Wbd&c=vnmc6CnC_LCW0ZHOuSG_ib2-_4PO3zimkkQBWny50cKGR5IVxiJd0g==&ch=HrEyxFG_oqE4Wh7urycZQ1jm8fyWul6JolzC8QXzoHDdMlZiJhPaug==> .

 

Content Marketing Wildfire

 

Shafqat Islam, co-founder and CEO of content marketing platform NewsCred, references a coming consolidation in his very own space in a guest post for VentureBeat. More than $100 million in "VC-backed deals have flooded the space," he writes. NewsCred is one of them. The company raised $25 million in Q4. But, herein the problem lies. "There are simply too many companies fighting for different parts of the content marketing stack," he adds. Could the bottom fall out? Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0016fb1LdiVJUfN2u04tkedJOWP5he1ajUppoBMt-_1wypG5VvX6wXUIx0Yo18b9PA6cDp9MkWG_1OogWH9fYzsHSAg3ZfijTR9fsls-BqN2S8tGBSMQJzt8Ypln_NZ6oE1Y5QrWctGXaiR9gYa7w2ECSLOH-Mpg3mx_62bXn_Clq0jjP-2lnqAK2hdWweAUbMsKweJYxxqE0QAzShUdanoKXQ-abCQ5_vLOufsqusjB5RB8zBf2Cq2rSso7fl_yoGFQ-_eixKRULTh3HQiXnNS4Q==&c=vnmc6CnC_LCW0ZHOuSG_ib2-_4PO3zimkkQBWny50cKGR5IVxiJd0g==&ch=HrEyxFG_oqE4Wh7urycZQ1jm8fyWul6JolzC8QXzoHDdMlZiJhPaug==> .

AppNexus Direct

 

A new "programmatic direct" solution from AppNexus aims to streamline negotiations that happen before digital ad buys occur. Using the product, called Twixt, "a buyer can send out RFPs out to a list of sellers, gather and compare their responses, negotiate line items, and agree to terms with publishers," reports AdAge. For the time being Twixt is free, perhaps to accelerate adoption in a crowded competitive environment that includes players like Yieldex, iSocket, Bionic Ads and AdSlot. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0015rCzZffJEE-xNifsKTNNCSlDcuJ_O36fzvxyyffsr5SrE0FbcQSoSHqcPKAXYlNTz2pkUkH4MtfeGV4L7eTsLE98HWkJMLn48g9OkVzk6Ruaz7HEdkFS0vGRwz2I6Xx0xWHiB_SK0WG9Tv09PXCbWQP4_egxa09YtuTvCtS6hWEmWrs1uzwkBvGHpKixz9cXbkTsIgFstsUJxvGXcwGMp0QC8GuO2I2GquOI-3r0GFtEuJzewGZW3BDWybc6M38f2ID0BUebqfY=&c=Zr4a7ZBAgjeJS5KLKPga-VaevjplZw6PEUE26QakbTm0Tg8iPHIm1Q==&ch=UXBTmOqUVjsntfVvn0H9v46H2HptoWNaa2c0jaSswnyrp1ptOvSfKQ==> .

 

Automating TV



NBCUniversal may use automation to sell some TV ad inventory at its Upfront this spring, through the use of private exchanges. The WSJ reports this is not the media conglomerate's first move to automate TV buying. When Interpublic Group of Cos partnered with several media companies last year to test a programmatic ad-buying platform for TV and radio, NBCU was purportedly on deck to join the group. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0015rCzZffJEE-xNifsKTNNCSlDcuJ_O36fzvxyyffsr5SrE0FbcQSoSHqcPKAXYlNT64S8eJ2aI58rJeNKbYhW84rROBKEvzovXvI69INnYISBQfogfxQm09o0h9oAL7b6d3ZnepQCwSKv551s_cN7W2rRETKAZGb4OXKrbRm2O7jhRBhfFUX7MiNZ6eh3XxeLUE42wqTyeZccHSO81ZerxDOMHequl3ZDFcSD1xWKRpCP74tlOwTlLC2_T68omTHISAitrSuvKA99UuXXILvcqZGpz-2Ty9aFuy_o7_UgFl8=&c=Zr4a7ZBAgjeJS5KLKPga-VaevjplZw6PEUE26QakbTm0Tg8iPHIm1Q==&ch=UXBTmOqUVjsntfVvn0H9v46H2HptoWNaa2c0jaSswnyrp1ptOvSfKQ==> .

 

Video Botnets

 

TubeMogul released a list of dozens of fraudulent sites that are generating as many as 30 million nonhuman video views per day. Adweek's Garett Sloane notes the video DSP uncovered three new sophisticated botnets generating faulty traffic and "contaminating advertiser cookie data." They are Blog Bot, Annex Bot and 411 Bot. Read more on the  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0015rCzZffJEE-xNifsKTNNCSlDcuJ_O36fzvxyyffsr5SrE0FbcQSoSHqcPKAXYlNT1PKxbNc5GwznrILqPQEUQT7pXZtXHZLGZycBwatRT6x0sewQ587aY0eRAT9hQ1mkRJI4y9BbWQdnqoUZ7ldNGtKBgCNYxmUgF6AofSggPwm_6dveTd4J_DXrvgAPiNNZckwfj7UJI1uksEiciyvAJ5jqE1zBTFBduJVDE9leBjP-RbhS82QtEWg2zPWwXC5fuvNgGD468MZmbiW-fA4puc1SO8M_yyPztZtkgNdP--4=&c=Zr4a7ZBAgjeJS5KLKPga-VaevjplZw6PEUE26QakbTm0Tg8iPHIm1Q==&ch=UXBTmOqUVjsntfVvn0H9v46H2HptoWNaa2c0jaSswnyrp1ptOvSfKQ==> "Clear Skies Initiative."



Social 'Accelerator' At Cond

 

A tool incubated by Ars Technica that predicts when a story will go viral will be adopted by its sibling publishing brands at Cond Nast. Called The Accelerator, the product's aim is to help Conde monetize social media traffic and sell ads next to popular Web content. It recalls a similar social media program, Ricochet, launched by The New York Times back in 2012. Such programs could help big publishers reduce their reliance on Facebook and Twitter. Digiday has the story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0015rCzZffJEE-xNifsKTNNCSlDcuJ_O36fzvxyyffsr5SrE0FbcQSoSHqcPKAXYlNT1XMUv2VPqcsPWu4Mw23d-xLtMbOsH1L9ltjdaz41OLhe_OhM4Dfq6MG1YraJRpQhZ5RBInvgnNbIhaGuncIvCAmgyE2MOUXR26zYio_10rRTBmfIElvCSftMFAl_6h1xvequFn2FrSqjU-9nXEi3jw==&c=Zr4a7ZBAgjeJS5KLKPga-VaevjplZw6PEUE26QakbTm0Tg8iPHIm1Q==&ch=UXBTmOqUVjsntfVvn0H9v46H2HptoWNaa2c0jaSswnyrp1ptOvSfKQ==> .

 

Yext Revenue

 

Yext revenues were $2.7 million in 2011, $14.7 million in 2012 and $33.8 million in 2013, CEO Howard Lerman disclosed in a DEMO conference preso last week. Lerman added that the 2014 run rate is $56 million. More. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0015rCzZffJEE-xNifsKTNNCSlDcuJ_O36fzvxyyffsr5SrE0FbcQSoSHqcPKAXYlNT22TUa5SJ62Uh7mmc3cot1zhYPwfdXw2XMyxQdML6DAszr4Ep9GO7eeBDMu5oMHt4Kpp_TSty_lXPp3PKWEBJJzlxwwH4OtWuPZSkwHkS9FpAkJdwZ_Y5CmpekTciTtLznT3hArg-d8vYRxTLNrFPqlKHrfsQDFOoio7voVkWIik=&c=Zr4a7ZBAgjeJS5KLKPga-VaevjplZw6PEUE26QakbTm0Tg8iPHIm1Q==&ch=UXBTmOqUVjsntfVvn0H9v46H2HptoWNaa2c0jaSswnyrp1ptOvSfKQ==>  The company has pivoted from a pay-per-call ad network to a licensed "geomarketing" solution, and Lerman says 100% of current sales come from recurring SaaS revenue.

 

Bain Invests In Kenshoo

 

Tel Aviv-based search and social platform Kenshoo has raised $20 million in a funding round led by Bain. The investment values the company between $400M and $500M, the WSJ reports. Kenshoo said the cash injection will support its global expansion plans. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0015rCzZffJEE-xNifsKTNNCSlDcuJ_O36fzvxyyffsr5SrE0FbcQSoSHqcPKAXYlNT39OE_NOx4jFgLsaogZOAhSL-Lz-3UnRRNYwxb5i9s9aUj-YFSibHaxFi78P6cXpyXxsiwk4GJgRjwo4F43PkwjKwfhxme8XMrvBQm7BYw8Nfg6IA8vEaj1Xj99Gl0X1yA3-qSOn1G9TVzylbbLUem0_GHKUz4a8m1KE0jVEydbagYD5MRjDVEp9MEFp8Mlu-MczE66TVBZNxDezqTRBI4OHXu0ls5lbTS_lFa7Go1SU=&c=Zr4a7ZBAgjeJS5KLKPga-VaevjplZw6PEUE26QakbTm0Tg8iPHIm1Q==&ch=UXBTmOqUVjsntfVvn0H9v46H2HptoWNaa2c0jaSswnyrp1ptOvSfKQ==> .

New CTO For AOL

 

After shuffling <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00157dkVvf2jm1iKL2JMeGe0-NQd9ovi1EdZu7B0UOadTTI-e36xJ5L7O-cu23dR4tMQIwNE9M5i7BOZVEumi7RRlaL1DTGf3IBOgaMo5W6Owz2-YiQJmdFEOKwC2xN-Vn8NBopR_pDdos7uaxsy8MUQqgSyl38rJ8tqQwSa-DksArYu-jIFjl2d5qcq2l1o06u00H68xwCqrxulS8P9kNi8UgkZC6njoE2koMaVzXuFbEGzOkiYoPOjpF7juvILElKBTYQ04E22HaN1D-e0QXaQGiQ8RXrIx8g&c=Ypb75ItU2CgJmP2e0AUMNF_9iy6PJiHNhQywGIPZFGdbUKUNOPvcJQ==&ch=bCl5kigJJ-bT81f1IqLX1FnHPQkyrUTEP_iiqReP-iMlU5CRYmPkBQ==>  CEO positions among the AOL Platforms ranks last week, AOL is targeting the C-level again. The company has appointed William Pence as global CTO, "who will lead all aspects of AOL's global technology strategy and will report directly to me," AOL CEO Tim Armstrong told TechCrunch. Most recently, Pence was WebMD's EVP and CTO, and reportedly had a track record of pushing new mobile products at his former company. Curtis Brown, AOL's CTO since 2012, will stay on with the company for a number of months through the transition. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00157dkVvf2jm1iKL2JMeGe0-NQd9ovi1EdZu7B0UOadTTI-e36xJ5L7MMnj6aotYlF3T_Man96OYS0jnzT2fYhkv6WuJmilW4FGpQN_4y50oZnshqHv-vJW_kmzKsObis3VnB0G2HBvGtN5dK0aTiqtuXO0-HP2RvPGOlLVhQh657YnoFaN5Bv0wGDEPbUxGscaHW6IrIaXIWM0SNCPUcWRdepSc6Abb9cMXZ6o_WoUEJzDhBXZzUnLWu5gkQt-BAceLFqL1wVOh8mw_MF1smFIueOfwQgRnNnfpZ7jSOwJRQ=&c=Ypb75ItU2CgJmP2e0AUMNF_9iy6PJiHNhQywGIPZFGdbUKUNOPvcJQ==&ch=bCl5kigJJ-bT81f1IqLX1FnHPQkyrUTEP_iiqReP-iMlU5CRYmPkBQ==> .

 

Tweet Ratings

 

Twitter has plans to extend TV measurement and support to far corners of every continent. Expanding a partnership with Kantar Media that covered the UK and Spain, both companies are now working to bring Twitter TV measurement standards and tools to Russia, the Nordics and parts of Africa and southeast Asia. Additionally, Twitter's brewing a research product called "Data of Now" to tie its public, real-time data to advertising effectiveness programs. More on Twitter's blog <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00157dkVvf2jm1iKL2JMeGe0-NQd9ovi1EdZu7B0UOadTTI-e36xJ5L7MMnj6aotYlF9zhHl29tL4gsmLVZIiL9w9GqdiMmPaMdiFBii2rL_nEKnTz1LqDiJDYNu2bbMnJfhnt7DqKIMftAjIVg3CNlGyk2avjY0m7il7MXUJMM1j571LrVkZCzLz27h5NvbpFcOUwsR0Tmh5MjxW17xnkpmIMZ9jfr43xBm15JgwSv_Z8=&c=Ypb75ItU2CgJmP2e0AUMNF_9iy6PJiHNhQywGIPZFGdbUKUNOPvcJQ==&ch=bCl5kigJJ-bT81f1IqLX1FnHPQkyrUTEP_iiqReP-iMlU5CRYmPkBQ==> .

 

Big Hire At AppNexus

 

Is AppNexus primed for an IPO - or a sale? With S-1s raining down from competitors, the company has tapped Jonathan Hsu, former chief executive at 24/7 Media, as its CFO/COO. Press release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00157dkVvf2jm1iKL2JMeGe0-NQd9ovi1EdZu7B0UOadTTI-e36xJ5L7MMnj6aotYlFgfvqGlI4xZDc6uMUvgRwhyL1ntwK8Dxm1bQJmT3Pr69No_mELpLCp3EbU-FIJk174J-6fF6LBzol6Z8Pp-fFAmdoUoZbsJL66Z5clgbzIhHOtDX8OlmsqIOJ9rMCUWiKwc4S9No9zONaCKIKEu0tcZ78I8XphaRi2P2RROSH64pmK70ZZEWMQSOM6ZEzeBammO6SdLC5nFJdPW7NpQ_fzUAUJWj-1xWQWe68e_8ebhVqZu7xtk9m1zlxLOijxBsC&c=Ypb75ItU2CgJmP2e0AUMNF_9iy6PJiHNhQywGIPZFGdbUKUNOPvcJQ==&ch=bCl5kigJJ-bT81f1IqLX1FnHPQkyrUTEP_iiqReP-iMlU5CRYmPkBQ==>  AppNexus probably doesn't need immediate cash in light of its $75 million raise <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00157dkVvf2jm1iKL2JMeGe0-NQd9ovi1EdZu7B0UOadTTI-e36xJ5L7BM3jcrBSaZrfMizeQDOPdEWE1d73LAZw9_hKcM2P_p4gMf8Nui2L_q8-Qo1Ff_ELePNV_VOZ2cGIfqMAA10sKDniRr5u3-irlqz-xXWLsf9i5w48vvqya_DzDX1paRmiZRopDnYlkzbPJjzOFbmX3SrR4avzlh8r8nY8W0bgef0dJemnrUreZyIZPOpXINJCg==&c=Ypb75ItU2CgJmP2e0AUMNF_9iy6PJiHNhQywGIPZFGdbUKUNOPvcJQ==&ch=bCl5kigJJ-bT81f1IqLX1FnHPQkyrUTEP_iiqReP-iMlU5CRYmPkBQ==>  in 2013, but may want to strike while the iron's hot. CEO Brian O'Kelley downplayed the possibility in an AdExchanger interview last year <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00157dkVvf2jm1iKL2JMeGe0-NQd9ovi1EdZu7B0UOadTTI-e36xJ5L7DNZijV-z72kQB4zQb3uJQW0xuL0B2O_Li-0whlFHBKfU2oZRNImHf6z5GrOs66GAOsYnhOFECTBqIllwj7WWZK0gPSu_lNckao_-KPkwiYxWTRk70u4FqkXnXTgQ2p61Q8xwGrrcmONPB6K-fKeNum4G8QTdsVyHYzDlZNzRQ-iBqjCV4GyH_pMJDjHQ9zwq7ksja_3iKNYu6CyiJB-shc=&c=Ypb75ItU2CgJmP2e0AUMNF_9iy6PJiHNhQywGIPZFGdbUKUNOPvcJQ==&ch=bCl5kigJJ-bT81f1IqLX1FnHPQkyrUTEP_iiqReP-iMlU5CRYmPkBQ==> , saying, "There's an argument to be made that we should be rushing out the door to take advantage of the hot market. The problem is I still have to run the company when it's not a hot market. ... It's just another financing round. Why would I want my investors to be irrational hedge funds?"

 

Smarter Video

 

Celtra on Monday launched its new Smart Video Ad Formats for mobile devices. The in-banner video units include features like auto-play and sound controls and interstitial capabilities. "Not all publishers can run pre-roll ads since not everyone has video content on their sites," Mihael Mikek, SVP of business development, told AdExchanger. "But Our Smart Video Ad Formats let publishers run in-stream video ads on apps or the mobile Web, giving them another way to monetize." Read more about Celtra in March <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00157dkVvf2jm1iKL2JMeGe0-NQd9ovi1EdZu7B0UOadTTI-e36xJ5L7P3UNj5uTIPWlEREeJGRNpSVFa6H7_txZSnYmBRRmmhLHgnURztzOP6G2nEmqEyJrVJXgKR4dJREOLqvDsKhPdfRvfgq5TJr7WZDJjEeZh2T6qxb3cTSRTCaOr8gsZJDccNZHAl4J4GfrX6TXh5iTrIhuHGkQLU78VoDyKNGhtbwPnPw6dfArABPxDn-NLXc90Mo0z8yTZAr6PPX0UDuRCM=&c=Ypb75ItU2CgJmP2e0AUMNF_9iy6PJiHNhQywGIPZFGdbUKUNOPvcJQ==&ch=bCl5kigJJ-bT81f1IqLX1FnHPQkyrUTEP_iiqReP-iMlU5CRYmPkBQ==> . And here's the Smart Video Ad press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=00157dkVvf2jm1iKL2JMeGe0-NQd9ovi1EdZu7B0UOadTTI-e36xJ5L7MMnj6aotYlFUjpM7B1s7sxpj6gwsQJrA9ToR3J4HXamRBB4NiFiwTRs9qMxQhCfYKc_9oXUHex_0FtVCqB4tMFXz0sLPFY0HQmTcv7fzu5cudwWFUlVL_W3RNg7nRKCM2evm9LsPnks0_mgRNDIyF9svP1S3PFAgI6EnlFgKpxKGPClT3Yp6kT34Cy_bqeJ_GMg3ZKpUGhF&c=Ypb75ItU2CgJmP2e0AUMNF_9iy6PJiHNhQywGIPZFGdbUKUNOPvcJQ==&ch=bCl5kigJJ-bT81f1IqLX1FnHPQkyrUTEP_iiqReP-iMlU5CRYmPkBQ==> .

More App Ads

 

The rumors around new Twitter app ad products continue to percolate as The Wall Street Journal reports on an imminent launch. Yoree Koh writes, "[Twitter] will debut 15 types of new ad products and improved ways to target users over the next six months, according to people familiar with the company's plans." Read about 'em (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kfxELj8ihMyIUSNHGxmUEUWuW62pMlksK5VuSwz0jUJ-lHTTAmomfKY9pjrEooQu8cZh2GisEiAsjbry1p4FCn8G05061D0HGa7sfZc3KImMUpE1tRPGZD4RJeQhqYWmgqrIpe8RPCidGQFfJOHaA3cukGRixsfGrlydnkNJrbaTODPRfxyzLDbWi-1kCfHcnJOEFFHrhuXtPfEknuwJJuOndbiIMeGilau_PJFGNI4GWoGjLwIrEGrEndYzSisc&c=bcD0Nm7wZ3-dw9A_qpGNQqnFZC9L8PKECtNsta8g3_PUnweVwsbACg==&ch=UG0QQklERVa9pFzfeePUtHSKVvVWdjvGB2KJ5V2OyxG9fWbH78oV0A==> . Meanwhile, a new report from Resolution Media says Twitter ads are more effective if you're measuring click-through rate in comparison to Facebook, but they lack FB's scale. Download it here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kfxELj8ihMyIUSNHGxmUEUWuW62pMlksK5VuSwz0jUJ-lHTTAmomfKY9pjrEooQupZba5lMR-r0wmAmeLFddVR1NfIt-mBaEMHZGlNx60zRgLsmym2WbU-w2VzFcRUjiQiCS_bkhhxp5h5rL048h8DwZHTnb3ZzaLlzigBnkR8jg0FDGP5b9b_aONkBPAfSymyrENbRFxsy6r2T0POH4gHO972DmVVJzMYWy23quNazXQ2LmqdZ51YDfP8fphuKn&c=bcD0Nm7wZ3-dw9A_qpGNQqnFZC9L8PKECtNsta8g3_PUnweVwsbACg==&ch=UG0QQklERVa9pFzfeePUtHSKVvVWdjvGB2KJ5V2OyxG9fWbH78oV0A==> . 


Purely Passively



A new study by researchers at Princeton University looks at the use of advertising cookies and privacy risks. Dillon Reisman, who spearheads the project as part of his senior thesis, introduces the paper in a blog post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kfxELj8ihMyIUSNHGxmUEUWuW62pMlksK5VuSwz0jUJ-lHTTAmomfKY9pjrEooQu1Q30xXL7spRbukpelmG2_UNd-Eay9KVZFe-TkAGTw0PI8giZFmZPCVnK19TmfYeoW3vtIrxgX2607HlGqGo6Y38HxQwjM2c7U-MXRL_CtDoqgQQJtaXxvkkCPvfOIw6adYqbskDuxm-nPjgfKsflnhr1NEIPIz9IVD-kxM-o8409cpxeGTHA41uHBeR9Ha773iFZFnr7Zl2MEdcytUtRJMRDlGS37E3e0smH3hQA-sYo1Pz8G1CAag==&c=bcD0Nm7wZ3-dw9A_qpGNQqnFZC9L8PKECtNsta8g3_PUnweVwsbACg==&ch=UG0QQklERVa9pFzfeePUtHSKVvVWdjvGB2KJ5V2OyxG9fWbH78oV0A==> : "Over the past three months we've learnt that NSA uses third-party tracking cookies for surveillance. These cookies, provided by a third-party advertising or analytics network (...), are ubiquitous on the web, and tag users' browsers with unique pseudonymous IDs. In a new paper, we study just how big a privacy problem this is. We quantify what an observer can learn about a user's web traffic by purely passively eavesdropping on the network, and arrive at surprising answers." Get the paper (PDF) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kfxELj8ihMyIUSNHGxmUEUWuW62pMlksK5VuSwz0jUJ-lHTTAmomfKY9pjrEooQukBnFJLRsfoEPHqpGzomYiu37PnUVL0XxMBmnNl9q-V09Oq7Nj_0XhhnDBjKnAG_WzQoMVwHvIBqZ4IL0keV2pWxjPqTon8JJa-PKM0fsZjtnUa3pcLAhkxx0uaSAH_fXIc7JaF6dzovQ6PrxwjPIwAYFMjZdUk43&c=bcD0Nm7wZ3-dw9A_qpGNQqnFZC9L8PKECtNsta8g3_PUnweVwsbACg==&ch=UG0QQklERVa9pFzfeePUtHSKVvVWdjvGB2KJ5V2OyxG9fWbH78oV0A==> .

 

Big Data, Big Problems

 

A recent study conducted by the World Federation of Advertisers highlights the five major challenges of big data for marketers. The biggest challenge is simply managing the sheer volume of data being generated. Other challenges include practically deploying insight, pinpointing expert analysts to manage the data, unreadiness to properly take advantage of what big data can do and improving understanding of ROI. Despite these challenges, 88% of marketers said big data was crucial for current and future business strategizing. Read more at Marketing Interactive <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kfxELj8ihMyIUSNHGxmUEUWuW62pMlksK5VuSwz0jUJ-lHTTAmomfKY9pjrEooQuO58qnQb5ZQi3ozs-NmL3yfB909bw1pB6PWx-lhq7_OixJDW3u9EO90jHcrkc5AQ9S4bw3iJlzhHXQ-TZDKc9ok1XzUR4QUrThIe4xi4JDbexHF4auhwVQO-57SPfOj_JaNb-DNHXgzDPm9W0GqShxzvnjhGfw4lb&c=bcD0Nm7wZ3-dw9A_qpGNQqnFZC9L8PKECtNsta8g3_PUnweVwsbACg==&ch=UG0QQklERVa9pFzfeePUtHSKVvVWdjvGB2KJ5V2OyxG9fWbH78oV0A==> .

 

New World Advertorials


Talking Points Memo has signed up Pharma and with it comes Pharma-written native ads, in turn reviving the moralistic debate on native advertising. If native ads are too successful, are they deceiving readers? Writing for the Columbia Journalism Review, Ryan Chittum argues, "Native ads are just advertorials by another name, and advertorials have long been published by news organizations of the highest standards, including The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and The New Yorker. Those 'special advertising sections' are the native ads of print, and they've been there for decades." Read on. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kfxELj8ihMyIUSNHGxmUEUWuW62pMlksK5VuSwz0jUJ-lHTTAmomfKY9pjrEooQu_yczIoUuKz53DSq5N-n2PWY_wpsEdcalotQ5e_xLfAXXslMF1d3Eat8zsPBebON8inTJHG0D7P161qxWOS07JS3xZeFHWBDdVVgWk2xS7EXmUEywKL8ZSVMPV65VGxJwdMW8GH-VgNEGZewaG_iNfvbU3MtpIvWD&c=bcD0Nm7wZ3-dw9A_qpGNQqnFZC9L8PKECtNsta8g3_PUnweVwsbACg==&ch=UG0QQklERVa9pFzfeePUtHSKVvVWdjvGB2KJ5V2OyxG9fWbH78oV0A==> 


Mozilla Machinations

 

From his personal blog, Mozilla VP of Content Services Darren Herman issues a battle cry to fellow employees in the wake of Brendan Eich's <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kfxELj8ihMyIUSNHGxmUEUWuW62pMlksK5VuSwz0jUJ-lHTTAmomfKY9pjrEooQubLkEqIYyhVQmzTXPVO3L0AIt5j_dTEHh1WWQDMcEsjAMQCF-tcnIJRAGtmJI_PSCiSSyPrWYDRS8L6-hWU9Dv8n-F1uZek7fRua6xcrJm2viwA8-636YjDpNmjdyu1yShFY0wobTU_qK2PqmzAcMK1FgelbaD-L7pTD6GVN3gEF7_Me-L8WIhjgIFuQn6fH9K6Ee6XG44b4=&c=bcD0Nm7wZ3-dw9A_qpGNQqnFZC9L8PKECtNsta8g3_PUnweVwsbACg==&ch=UG0QQklERVa9pFzfeePUtHSKVvVWdjvGB2KJ5V2OyxG9fWbH78oV0A==>  exit from the company as CEO. He begins, "I'm sitting in my hotel room in San Francisco having bought a one-way ticket here late this past Wednesday night. Why did I come out with no end in sight? I bought a ticket because we were in the midst of a crisis and wanted to be closer to our senior leadership team and board." Automating Sales

 

News Corp. platforms exec Cameron King tells AdNews in Australia that his company aims to "move programmatic into the mainstream sales effort." King has sipped from the cup of programmatic Kool-Aid. AdNews says, "[King] would not hang a number around the organisation's neck in terms of percentage of sales traded programmatically but said there was 'an opportunity to automate a great deal of what we are doing.'" Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0019BpP2US12_saPM5gjengLf_by97hxEQ3hWZZEmTUYCq169PNdDkKQ3F8TuMQ6PUsj3YCXu6ZRwzMyFjOSVC9TPdCocwMTw01VwvBMop9WKB_blfS0h09KUy7B7AGe50Oj-GevhXMK7GiNw6jsrEc9qYm6_L4yAZTFWw9fGqW274_Ww_fREBx-YJjsV019tfbUMHU5SD0bEabbG98F5SLYazvN7BZu38rDjNZh1gU5pg=&c=Y_rpmQhZ1SMPe379AnJMyYiPC_hPSp4inFFoBJbiswlr7JMqe4F5Sg==&ch=cDdQNN2aazSdrV2TB1ir0zyCUSRZhS3w9YJqW9lMudVHaPVZw_4rkA==> .

 

Amazon

 

Amazon's European director, Dan Wright, describes the company's marketing strategy, claiming that innovation in not as paramount as customer trust and satisfaction. He pointed to Amazon's ecommerce ads as an example, saying, "Customers want to see ratings and reviews before making a purchase, so we have added value by putting those in the ad. ... Amazon's vision is to be the earth's most customer centric company. If we're good at that then advertisers and marketers win too." Marketing Week has the story.

 

Havas Unfazed

 

In his first public appearance to date, Havas CEO Yannick Bollor admitted that while the Publicis and Omnicom merger came as a surprise, he remained optimistic. In fact, speaking at Advertising Week Europe, Bollor suggested that the recent partnership could help boost Havas' clientele. Commenting on a recently secured $150m Emirates account, Bollor said, "I don't want to be too optimistic but when I look at the recent wins, we are facing a good momentum." Bollor also alluded to the fact that the merger may funnel new talent Havas' way as Publicis and Omnicom reassemble into one organization. Read more via The Drum <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0019BpP2US12_saPM5gjengLf_by97hxEQ3hWZZEmTUYCq169PNdDkKQ3F8TuMQ6PUsR9WbWysAcM2rYphe9XcjEmNGsa_5MROtQziPgmv9J1suaCj3hl0ObamtccnSIElRH9Syn16WUIuaAOkA4gb7FIdnkZ8kQYuIa1Pb2URgMDADO2mQbjo2arJZ_O4LHAnbli4QWD3Ek3TmMZW8KdKAZ0e36T4ClOehZ14IRAxOyJVisJGRglJbuPnU3NApYDcEfmsyfy8VDsMU2fgBowIRj1gr-gK3dbC1TCZxsD3zoa8Wm5f8vjSWLQ==&c=Y_rpmQhZ1SMPe379AnJMyYiPC_hPSp4inFFoBJbiswlr7JMqe4F5Sg==&ch=cDdQNN2aazSdrV2TB1ir0zyCUSRZhS3w9YJqW9lMudVHaPVZw_4rkA==> .

 

Ad Network Secure

 

The WSJD team talks about how encryption and the recent explosion regarding NSA snooping is affecting Yahoo. The company says that it's now using HTTPS in places, but the blog reports that "for large media companies that rely on lots of ad networks, that can take a lot of coordination 'It's a little harder than to just flip a switch,'" said Alex Stamos, Yahoo's new chief information security officer. He added, "It's just a bigger project than I expected." Read it (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0019BpP2US12_saPM5gjengLf_by97hxEQ3hWZZEmTUYCq169PNdDkKQ3F8TuMQ6PUs8VfEzB2KwdVccBp8QosWkQU9KiiB4bIMCmUXKrHGfDh9z4q-CrAa-zm2y8m4yNHGQF9aRQg9ebqAItyblZTXZhGTOnphzXxchH50bH3s5ByqoF_IbPlM14szdzeQ_nRrnbmYIfdnrOTs2EOHHHzu3Exf0aEDoe1sKKyrPAL48ROs2TKi0viUY-B-KwBSLp1THGge8MIRcVShxEiAiHYYrw==&c=Y_rpmQhZ1SMPe379AnJMyYiPC_hPSp4inFFoBJbiswlr7JMqe4F5Sg==&ch=cDdQNN2aazSdrV2TB1ir0zyCUSRZhS3w9YJqW9lMudVHaPVZw_4rkA==> . 


Non-Lethal Technology



After reviewing recent research from Forrester on how marketers don't understand programmatic ad buying, angel investor Jerry Neumann weighs in on his Reaction Wheel blog. He writes, "It's almost certainly true, as [ANA's Bob] Liodice says, that confusion about programmatic is slowing its adoption. I believe this because it has also been true of every non-lethal technology in history. It takes time for new technologies to win the market, and different customer sets adopt them at different rates. Everett Rogers wrote about this back in 1962." Read about Everett and more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0019BpP2US12_saPM5gjengLf_by97hxEQ3hWZZEmTUYCq169PNdDkKQ3F8TuMQ6PUsfAnnDaUr41ObT1cl3U9pYCcRsEtTKKXcuHFeD4oyZM_rldjJPwAMHMjmVwyiNQ0WtzmmocOoIIYP71GtFBzT36rnULNppnmnCEtqN9IBz6zjtQKmy0cVls_fsLp4siJkdwu4W-04_PC_gDHfjX0K4U9s7WKhSxJQ0GT1l49oWKgtBMiR6vGeROHitNY4-7-hAghk7zVFvL06pbq6kCtfpEULuIF7xedc&c=Y_rpmQhZ1SMPe379AnJMyYiPC_hPSp4inFFoBJbiswlr7JMqe4F5Sg==&ch=cDdQNN2aazSdrV2TB1ir0zyCUSRZhS3w9YJqW9lMudVHaPVZw_4rkA==> .

More Social Consolidation

 

Social marketing startups Spredfast and Mass Relevance are merging. Spredfast CEO Rod Favaron will head the combined company, which will operate under Spredfast's name. The deal combines Mass Relevance's social curation tools for TV with Spredfast's social media management and analytics. According to Favaron, the mission is "to connect every place social content is consumed, across all screens." Read more via AdAge <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0013LDvaxlwWVWbOZcrS_HEqOUB66V23otDbB7g_K_hYIO4pYhjkstCMEJ6DybVF2dCcXOxSrmZu0l9Nblz2OFKtwLew_LTITl9UHbO4p7xu9c56ePqPq89J-90FJQjMuHs-oCN4piS2Egenu2fhl9zU1871LuTOov79Z9Cd7YTCGJ6gpsOpxD3sHlcPHRbnl_ElExCOYHhwj9hrG0BJDWb24AzYK7dIu6u4wRZ-gskKYZrlZ5MM2aikD-fRMw9KMCylNiqQ5Z45Gwb4fWFaC6B38oe04buS1Zj&c=H3aJ2-Gs3OKIQVg20Y6ySvV9KnjqSc2Gg-HUzp7Vor5VqhINy2pgtw==&ch=XHmfX0-V0BtPSZWa9aY_nFfF_brFBzh3hYz7e8U_Kd2tekeBb_1ngQ==> . Mass Relevance CEO Sam Decker moves to a board role. Read last year's AdExchanger article with Decker here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0013LDvaxlwWVWbOZcrS_HEqOUB66V23otDbB7g_K_hYIO4pYhjkstCMCUqT7c_yyVAzDF3qPZsPoFmkbeem28-QOtCjZLcoKSsqRo0tMwkrzFyisnOEwRefBAi68rpBZtcU3zEJH9GUFyvc9e1PjVF9t_jdl0-5yjMEM1QTWfUdaPsWq4fbtsOBRpLuZbSSwfIh2bDRD5yP-sWZF2HOZNop_ON-Ffu2tU3631sTPPF4vtWZWRA7uHxkKnnL5AGIrOW02nR4YuLhO7Awkrnra0MNZYBofPjar7hLRffNk9w9wI=&c=H3aJ2-Gs3OKIQVg20Y6ySvV9KnjqSc2Gg-HUzp7Vor5VqhINy2pgtw==&ch=XHmfX0-V0BtPSZWa9aY_nFfF_brFBzh3hYz7e8U_Kd2tekeBb_1ngQ==> . 



Merged Media

 

Writing for MediaWeek, Dax Hamman discusses "the end of the media category" in the programmatic era. He pontificates, "From a marketing perspective ... it will become nonsensical to define internet-connected media content by its delivery mechanism." Read the full story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0013LDvaxlwWVWbOZcrS_HEqOUB66V23otDbB7g_K_hYIO4pYhjkstCMEJ6DybVF2dC_QFUtM7zPy4NuxLvZvcortEI8JofRxCEOhJR1JXQYH_KDpGRXYaPKADAqymSKdkfmF-D_ALy64von4ctEfDDX_6uryv2VIgVgS_PcVpwhyi5441VfdyEW2ZzkzU-2vl-reF5jwmLffgWBZfr7KLHY9GaFy5vbk0pxIxOi61DcToLr09FiM1bwDbYQPrqgUuOKqxDzE8x3SNjt-pE4Mrqu-PrpaUD63IW&c=H3aJ2-Gs3OKIQVg20Y6ySvV9KnjqSc2Gg-HUzp7Vor5VqhINy2pgtw==&ch=XHmfX0-V0BtPSZWa9aY_nFfF_brFBzh3hYz7e8U_Kd2tekeBb_1ngQ==> . 



Google Hugs Nielsen

 

Google will upgrade its use of Nielsen's Online Campaign Ratings from an experiment to a legit trading currency. Mediapost notes Google will continue to offer marketers and agencies ComScore's vCE ratings. A Nielsen spokesperson affirmed, "This development underscores our unique ability to deliver meaningful cross-platform insights to clients and the momentum of our efforts to deliver independent measurement of advertising campaigns across distribution platforms." Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0013LDvaxlwWVWbOZcrS_HEqOUB66V23otDbB7g_K_hYIO4pYhjkstCMEJ6DybVF2dCGb9_0KYDtbGBhb4EpNct1RxnrQ23FFw2UNQIOnFT3A-toYG4IMiDj7wKXmr1U3JqlKcXwBp7lTbQfpoGBSeah-ijCUcabY00nnken5UEY4M_DWM7SFEX11_Dt74ohDqfrisJ-LXKSqV1yOFHL5gTnbaUzJMcaHQnFbZfk3Nl0j6nJnb7rPOwDAf7MStzlt4B-1qH6H0YqS7lJ9753jycvRUpyKZeUc15&c=H3aJ2-Gs3OKIQVg20Y6ySvV9KnjqSc2Gg-HUzp7Vor5VqhINy2pgtw==&ch=XHmfX0-V0BtPSZWa9aY_nFfF_brFBzh3hYz7e8U_Kd2tekeBb_1ngQ==> .

 

Facebook Apologist

 

Saleforce Marketing Cloud CMO Michael Lazerow take umbrage with the tide of rage against Facebook's changing algorithms (think Eat24's viral and public breakup <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0013LDvaxlwWVWbOZcrS_HEqOUB66V23otDbB7g_K_hYIO4pYhjkstCMEJ6DybVF2dCMNDjmKdmQ_fj2E0tXEaTwEtzuoZXA9FHbRuCcp0miOsYzGpCnd02keL2ZyECK_dJ4i9UXT7Xl2da9fcDRMiKAk6bjSXFtL-x9BQuA7KouUlyevWC57cOsZXKwJgMj-QUED1atJYC8xhv4dv_E5eiPJWFIgq4rbSYPnFFHZJIxmWpAU-qB1-qqA==&c=H3aJ2-Gs3OKIQVg20Y6ySvV9KnjqSc2Gg-HUzp7Vor5VqhINy2pgtw==&ch=XHmfX0-V0BtPSZWa9aY_nFfF_brFBzh3hYz7e8U_Kd2tekeBb_1ngQ==>  with FB). Writing for Re/code, Lazerow suggests there's nothing reprehensible about the constriction of organic reach in the News Feed. Rather, he argues Facebook's strategy follows a familiar trajectory in digital advertising where businesses follow consumers onto new platforms, and free distribution decreases as competition rises. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0013LDvaxlwWVWbOZcrS_HEqOUB66V23otDbB7g_K_hYIO4pYhjkstCMEJ6DybVF2dCk3FguSgTAr8rmNh79MNOUtRSQbOqcJAqnnI31Gnd47J9sYtdYTc--RfsDnceEujEH-jqN4KTF5OOLeFqdQHXl4tj1S9uAIbSXdXhbTVaM_n6Vx7evwMJpkLR-YUe-T0AT_7MKmX4Y1npyCulsTHAdcIJ5UmDceiJdxvLGjQj0IELwx7D-2Xlsw==&c=H3aJ2-Gs3OKIQVg20Y6ySvV9KnjqSc2Gg-HUzp7Vor5VqhINy2pgtw==&ch=XHmfX0-V0BtPSZWa9aY_nFfF_brFBzh3hYz7e8U_Kd2tekeBb_1ngQ==> .

 

YouTube Rollup

 

DreamWorks digital unit AwesomenessTV acquired YouTube multichannel network Big Frame in a $15M deal. The deal brings together 80 million subscribers and almost 1 billion views per month, Variety reports. The idea is to develop talent that will "transcend YouTube." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0013LDvaxlwWVWbOZcrS_HEqOUB66V23otDbB7g_K_hYIO4pYhjkstCMEJ6DybVF2dCUv1FksIMaLmZZ--SxkIKgbWPfUnes2o3rMska2JyrSHX5yXkoz9bCZVzAd7xemdmcap6Bl01TCxt3NhHuomwWiUzb_5vAQZy7fkMHxjj5H1vUbikaKuRIU418_9l6d2IUPhsaFp-queBRtMnkxhg90uLj7mWZi4xni7MO00He2AKkl5uDLkvOb31XKz8ITWD78XuduxcSHKmbbG2zKhp8-rdW-38l3PG7K8qqN31rDc=&c=H3aJ2-Gs3OKIQVg20Y6ySvV9KnjqSc2Gg-HUzp7Vor5VqhINy2pgtw==&ch=XHmfX0-V0BtPSZWa9aY_nFfF_brFBzh3hYz7e8U_Kd2tekeBb_1ngQ==> .

ComScore's Global Metrics



ComScore released Tuesday a new audience metric designed to measure global audiences of unique individuals across multiple platforms. "With a huge and growing proportion of our traffic coming from non-PC devices such as smartphones and tablets, it is commercially vital to both understand these incremental audiences and be able to represent them fully to the global media buying community," said Mike Pilcher, comScore's senior vice president for sales, EMEA. Read the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kp8qBFU02ZFAhnOSHsOuV0CcF-fq-gZujy5g8ik5XttbZU94_5SWGyN4jqJ0thrbXmmmiHjSDNryT32OtSVJ1gAQvc-YB3i46mIbyC6_YauzgqiP-HSwVRVCt-x7oB_0j3a-D4iN_2mkhOVDHPLQSjK_wcPEtfS5CgMdMY_Co3OUH4XXlCfopCigACpnnzxk0sq3rZlRM1PK5NdNWMzulrKjeYatcAepJnaYaHh67DpSwWJksu_XoonXTFFls-dqua-Vo2cSWsuFgNeq5lDtUQ0iPecIu7D-AMiRs32BRBg_cQsAlQXnGBDv7aoncYti-50uxVRpm-Y=&c=QHj0u7q7FLlmSsHr851cB3T_2HXKOExPVO6599N_CArXvXtJLp3Baw==&ch=Lu5eyUriFurqHApAl6J5CAqvMpKLybfTWzQIvAOnpUPD0zQ3C_Xbaw==> .

 

April Fools

 

Food delivery startup Eat24's public breakup with Facebook on Tuesday garnered significant attention from the business press. Among other grievances, Eat24's grounds for divorce pointed to Facebook's changing algorithms and a lack of trust. Is this the dawn of the marketer rebellions against Facebook? Doug Weaver deliberates in his latest column on The Drift <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kp8qBFU02ZFAhnOSHsOuV0CcF-fq-gZujy5g8ik5XttbZU94_5SWGyN4jqJ0thrbT-MtdzMYud4mXeNCTkMySItKP0TzY8YQ3h9d98JZfnKmGJhyLcmMvmKbbmX1ClEllBuSpcl8skJuDC_inTPrWXgtIAld884TFE_wdYYalnocD-xz6B7X77rIKE7Os9-S&c=QHj0u7q7FLlmSsHr851cB3T_2HXKOExPVO6599N_CArXvXtJLp3Baw==&ch=Lu5eyUriFurqHApAl6J5CAqvMpKLybfTWzQIvAOnpUPD0zQ3C_Xbaw==> .

 

Dj Vu

 

In the battle for social TV dominance Twitter can't beat Facebook with scale, so it's trying with technology. Ad Age reported Facebook TV analytics partner SecondSync (based in the UK) was snatched up by Twitter, just as former Facebook partners Trendrr and Bluefin Labs were. Kantar Media, which has a minority stake in SecondSync, also announced plans to expand its partnership with Twitter. Twitter also bought French social TV analytics company Mesagraph. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kp8qBFU02ZFAhnOSHsOuV0CcF-fq-gZujy5g8ik5XttbZU94_5SWGyN4jqJ0thrbmxAYyalyyzrRxMmZQDgvr06_ihh6k_FQdjT5jeUgqvzWefxiw9SN_MtmuDtLFP2lDIbiEhYyEz2hiaWfdG2DfCXxWg4uQl58mTKBUgM0ymHjwcBM3tVn8U-lOij1TYlFjlipscDQukVCJOrP71srVH2vneW9UPO4td-b5GQ5113F-A3fdeq0q8xw1veVWFOOh4vXGGjr6uE=&c=QHj0u7q7FLlmSsHr851cB3T_2HXKOExPVO6599N_CArXvXtJLp3Baw==&ch=Lu5eyUriFurqHApAl6J5CAqvMpKLybfTWzQIvAOnpUPD0zQ3C_Xbaw==> .

 

Apps Dominate The Mobile Web



According to a recent report by Flurry Analytics, US consumers spend an average of two hours and 42 minutes per day on mobile devices, up from 2 hours and 28 minutes per day in March of 2013. Eighty-six percent of that time is spent using apps, whereas 14% of time is spent on mobile browsers. Here's a shocker: Mobile applications are poised to monetize through advertising. "EMarketer also projects that the mobile ad market will grow 75% this year, making the opportunity even bigger." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kp8qBFU02ZFAhnOSHsOuV0CcF-fq-gZujy5g8ik5XttbZU94_5SWGyN4jqJ0thrbwpZiM1s80khWFVMRsQrkfHnfau3v0x-unhZlvtQKN_Vt492KHVj7fVPTO7_mNSyHl7OmNZtWBaysHT8aYETgy_xH9xDeGTRdXsgwaWzObVCDsb3PyRIOf-QCU7ivXuTCpm0BXWV6gk0-WOa9gVLd5FNUm_br4TqSugSlvvVl9iz730sOZtQYYRGaz1Qkni5kqFEUDsONr66Yz8kn4MdCcw==&c=QHj0u7q7FLlmSsHr851cB3T_2HXKOExPVO6599N_CArXvXtJLp3Baw==&ch=Lu5eyUriFurqHApAl6J5CAqvMpKLybfTWzQIvAOnpUPD0zQ3C_Xbaw==> .

 

Mobile, And Beyond

 

Mobile ad firm 4INFO is taking its technology cross-screen with a new product, AdHaven Bullseye MultiScreen. "Because we solved the mobile targeting issue first, 4INFO can reach the same households online by working with our data partners to extend the bidding process to defined households using the online industry standard of cookies," said 4INFO CEO Tim Jenkins. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001kp8qBFU02ZFAhnOSHsOuV0CcF-fq-gZujy5g8ik5XttbZU94_5SWGyN4jqJ0thrb1aBTMaK_FF7l9drXe6ZzLGJGG7i2J9V6KN5G5SLESoU7GPwMV0hmHtpSFeTa-VcoBI8KA1IIfWL6galVNnncqsXtpVX3t1eKpe4ed5M1XylMy1x4lkBb39f9YZHO1UPMjpCbt1akvX4JKWqP0Zf1ZMod68yd03mE&c=QHj0u7q7FLlmSsHr851cB3T_2HXKOExPVO6599N_CArXvXtJLp3Baw==&ch=Lu5eyUriFurqHApAl6J5CAqvMpKLybfTWzQIvAOnpUPD0zQ3C_Xbaw==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001aRtmx2ibFJHnEkhMnjC9vHdNlejPvwJ3hk-HsVlm_8oHf7UgoCqO0zhujobkb-dWcy0R1WjIYEs3OHxOFFarv9f9-JkiJderDcNsr4L--kaVZ5LEbGMJ_qB1K0HKKvo6bm6pl3WwmpXRsYAUb3q_M6bThsK6sGaiNo42Nl92zkyukCyKIzpFxxwgNbKz0IOx&c=E-japI9NujEgYFJ3H64SVGPpXsinttUst-8NtPSYRwy77vDDao3ClA==&ch=LSP5E1Qy0KB1il_eHCrgn22j-d2FH8UKNbtoKUzvATLEQhuXRn0eTQ==> .

 

Wunderman Buys Commerce Tech

 

Agency network Wunderman has acquired FusePump, whose technology is designed to make product information from ecommerce sites and other sources available to marketers and advertisers. According to the release, "Wunderman will gain access to FusePump technology and platforms such as BuyNow, a solution that refers consumers to product offers and allows brands to promote their retail partner offers in other digital channels." More. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001aRtmx2ibFJHnEkhMnjC9vHdNlejPvwJ3hk-HsVlm_8oHf7UgoCqO0-gUVUsDs11xpnF6FTbDcv7iU9R5z1JHhXzZKvXR4BhCAZJq41g4cX71rDVSbsy9J93U4FhInpK2ia2tNnrkvNEDOooONcMJpErAuX1GhS7DiVuk1STm2cgBORfbkCeSi_3RLt8oEhFZJcnNZAgiOQGraGnWrNncYOoYoQU8k1MQCAUQTt7RhC31_RzmspPa88BF9CJ1ulxmuKwPDE_4cP4=&c=E-japI9NujEgYFJ3H64SVGPpXsinttUst-8NtPSYRwy77vDDao3ClA==&ch=LSP5E1Qy0KB1il_eHCrgn22j-d2FH8UKNbtoKUzvATLEQhuXRn0eTQ==> 



Unmeasurable Audience

 

Michael Wolff uses his USA Today column to punch holes in the huge audience counts trotted out by some publishers, citing the prevalence of non-human traffic and "tabloid-like headlines" written for social sharability. Turns out, he writes, "The Internet, once extolled as the first truly measurable medium, wherein publishers and marketers would be able to precisely track usage and behavior, was not measurable at all - far less than even loosey-goosey conventional media." More. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001aRtmx2ibFJHnEkhMnjC9vHdNlejPvwJ3hk-HsVlm_8oHf7UgoCqO0-gUVUsDs11xiHGuxl-lvT6RqOliQAsA9UNcHazwCmPZUdPFu8PRQJTqk2JGM_lL6o9bIJVBIM3pt-IitZFCM39wTrByUtRmUjiRec_YeKDj9UBopPBO3Rpe44NYDorJXErJaGTgEwJi1lTHpm2xrKYGF78axnJ166MK3493tQ9WRIGN_iCCWtDpFlPuYNB8a9wVyIwSMnLWQpypt8btetxazw2xXafq28QFEDsl3oi3aoIc_nYp-bxL50c9je09og==&c=E-japI9NujEgYFJ3H64SVGPpXsinttUst-8NtPSYRwy77vDDao3ClA==&ch=LSP5E1Qy0KB1il_eHCrgn22j-d2FH8UKNbtoKUzvATLEQhuXRn0eTQ==>  Now there's cold assessment on MRC's "advisory lifting" day for viewability data.

 

Viewable Nielsen



Nielsen and Integral Ad Science have deepened a partnership that began in early 2012. The verification vendor will now power viewability metrics within Nielsen Online Campaign Ratings in more countries, including the U.S., Australia, Brazil, Canada, France, Germany, Italy and the U.K. Read the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001aRtmx2ibFJHnEkhMnjC9vHdNlejPvwJ3hk-HsVlm_8oHf7UgoCqO0-gUVUsDs11xFbpJrxEJuWoE7iI7JdkLMgGC_8DSI5Adwv7GIeGBGa_5YlkdQ9hZSEr6a73_JxW2HRZRkAw0KkcpkNYu3Izrfi7zDofuLdB_5wGlWSizmlOdmy-dBnCDksG2lG_LijwqKHYotrZTy1tdri9waXoGXRvjKVBEzY_pV1MS3q--hVM9ocxNmP-VBxUiBgYFkcwHW2t__Rhp4lyQvdOJ1roG1fCa4JPOY-REsmKM70k766MPrOu5jbi4dhQqqglAD8q7t9LrofzTUaM=&c=E-japI9NujEgYFJ3H64SVGPpXsinttUst-8NtPSYRwy77vDDao3ClA==&ch=LSP5E1Qy0KB1il_eHCrgn22j-d2FH8UKNbtoKUzvATLEQhuXRn0eTQ==> .

 

Cross-Screen Connection

 

Mobile DSP Tapad has licensed its cross-device ID solution to offline and in-store data arbiter Datalogix. The partnership aims to combine Datalogix's offline sales acumen with Tapad's cross-screen Unify platform. Datalogix CEO Eric Roza said the move "increases our mobile footprint and extends engagement beyond the desktop to smartphones and their apps, creating more opportunities for brands to provide offers and information to their most important customers and prospects." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001aRtmx2ibFJHnEkhMnjC9vHdNlejPvwJ3hk-HsVlm_8oHf7UgoCqO0-gUVUsDs11xpM5U-m2ieqVh5HqLGyUsG__blaeK7dzWfXDDTdkidpDB6Eq147F-YBb2fsQ52YTFFMF8vnBjvqHq7Bbu7jMbFCEQd5dReRL3h2NYjC8meMGm1AJTR73Q8CUqsks_Vrsj-u44SGhaPpQ=&c=E-japI9NujEgYFJ3H64SVGPpXsinttUst-8NtPSYRwy77vDDao3ClA==&ch=LSP5E1Qy0KB1il_eHCrgn22j-d2FH8UKNbtoKUzvATLEQhuXRn0eTQ==> .

 

Aligning Online and Offline Shopping

Ecommerce giant Alibaba has teamed with department store operator Intime to take online shopping offline. The partnership will give Alibaba access to Intime's offline inventory product database, while delivering promotions to Intime's customers through mobile apps and in-store location-based tech. Read more via The Next Web.
